Job Title: Stoic Software Engineer in Quality Assurance
Job Description:
ABOUT US
ProctorExam is a fast-growing technology company based in Amsterdam.
To date, our platform has connected hundred of thousands of test takers, spread out across more than 170 countries, to take an exam remotely, whether it is to complete a university semester, take a language test, start driving a drone or validate a medical certification.From our beginnings in 2014, the candidate experience has been at the center of our operations, introducing the first mobile experience to facilitate security verifications, and as importantly, designing a solution with privacy at its core. Today, millions of minutes are spent on our platform each month.
WORKING WITH US
You will join our growing technical department and you’ll help shape and develop a more mature team. You'll be surrounded by talented professionals. Some are passionate about honing their craft and applying it to delivering world-class experiences. Others are equally passionate about developing high performing teams in tandem with deliverables. Both are critical. We wear many hats and roll up our sleeves. We collaborate and help each other. We do what needs to get done to deliver on our commitments and deliver amazing products to our customers and users.
Job Description
YOUR DUTIES
Work closely with other development team members to understand all features and how to best integrate testing workflows.
Help product managers identifying and setting requirements for all possible user flows, including the ability to translate SLA requirements into technical requirements that can be tested.
Contributing to the architectural designs made by the team, ensuring they take into account testing requirements.
Help implement the CI/CD/CD pipeline.
Complement the whole team, as well as the development team, to improve bug management and bug visibility
Operate in an Agile development environment while collaborating with key stakeholders
Resolve complex technical issues as necessary
Keep abreast of new technology developments
Qualifications
YOU MUST HAVE (STRIVE FOR)
Wisdom - enough to understand what is better and why
Moderation - enough to know how to incrementally improve
Justice - enough to be unbiased in judgment
Courage - enough to keep your wits around you when things go the wrong way
YOU SHOULD HAVE
Experience with Agile software development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban,...)
Experience with web application quality assurance
Experience with test automation planning, setup and reporting
Some experience with load testing planning, execution and reporting
Some experience with CI/CD/CD processes and tools
Some experience with containerised applications and distributed systems
An innovative mindset, with the capability to think outside-of-the-box
A pragmatic mindset, with the ability of quickly applying out-of-the-box solutions
Understanding of the difference between out-of-the-box and outside-of-the-box
Understanding in industry best practices in quality management
Ability to work well in a team, willingness to help others, to give and receive feedback and compromise when needed
Strong analytical capacity
Excellent communications skills
Eligible to work in the EU, in Amsterdam (not remote) or willingness to relocate
IN YOUR APPLICATION COVER LETTER YOU MUST EXPLICITLY
Share an event where you believe your stoicism was proved
Additional Information
WHAT DO WE OFFER?
Working at ProctorExam means working in a dynamic, yet flexible and supportive environment, with a team who truly believes in collaboration and multiculturality. If you are an entrepreneurial spirit who wants to make a difference and see the impact of your actions, contact us today! Do you feel like getting to know us better and would you like to have a (virtual) coffee with us?
We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Job Title: Stoic Software Engineer in Quality Assurance
Job Description:
ABOUT US
ProctorExam is a fast-growing technology company based in Amsterdam.
To date, our platform has connected hundred of thousands of test takers, spread out across more than 170 countries, to take an exam remotely, whether it is to complete a university semester, take a language test, start driving a drone or validate a medical certification.From our beginnings in 2014, the candidate experience has been at the center of our operations, introducing the first mobile experience to facilitate security verifications, and as importantly, designing a solution with privacy at its core. Today, millions of minutes are spent on our platform each month.
WORKING WITH US
You will join our growing technical department and you’ll help shape and develop a more mature team. You'll be surrounded by talented professionals. Some are passionate about honing their craft and applying it to delivering world-class experiences. Others are equally passionate about developing high performing teams in tandem with deliverables. Both are critical. We wear many hats and roll up our sleeves. We collaborate and help each other. We do what needs to get done to deliver on our commitments and deliver amazing products to our customers and users.
Job Description
YOUR DUTIES
Work closely with other development team members to understand all features and how to best integrate testing workflows.
Help product managers identifying and setting requirements for all possible user flows, including the ability to translate SLA requirements into technical requirements that can be tested.
Contributing to the architectural designs made by the team, ensuring they take into account testing requirements.
Help implement the CI/CD/CD pipeline.
Complement the whole team, as well as the development team, to improve bug management and bug visibility
Operate in an Agile development environment while collaborating with key stakeholders
Resolve complex technical issues as necessary
Keep abreast of new technology developments
Qualifications
YOU MUST HAVE (STRIVE FOR)
Wisdom - enough to understand what is better and why
Moderation - enough to know how to incrementally improve
Justice - enough to be unbiased in judgment
Courage - enough to keep your wits around you when things go the wrong way
YOU SHOULD HAVE
Experience with Agile software development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban,...)
Experience with web application quality assurance
Experience with test automation planning, setup and reporting
Some experience with load testing planning, execution and reporting
Some experience with CI/CD/CD processes and tools
Some experience with containerised applications and distributed systems
An innovative mindset, with the capability to think outside-of-the-box
A pragmatic mindset, with the ability of quickly applying out-of-the-box solutions
Understanding of the difference between out-of-the-box and outside-of-the-box
Understanding in industry best practices in quality management
Ability to work well in a team, willingness to help others, to give and receive feedback and compromise when needed
Strong analytical capacity
Excellent communications skills
Eligible to work in the EU, in Amsterdam (not remote) or willingness to relocate
IN YOUR APPLICATION COVER LETTER YOU MUST EXPLICITLY

About PVH Corp.
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
The Team
You will be joining the B2B WebShop team responsible for design, development and maintenance of our Brands B2B WebShops. On this journey you will be part of the teams responsible for SPA running in the cloud that need to be available 24/7 for PVH customers around the world and provide them with the best user experience.
The Position
As a member of B2B WebShop SPA team you will be responsible for building the next generation of SPA for our brands Tommy Hilfiger and Calvin Klein in multiple locales and markets by using Agile methodologies. In collaboration with business you will be responsible for delivering extraordinary user experience to PVH B2B Consumers.
Key Responsibilities:
working in Agile and DevOps way
owning full life cycle from idea, design, development and support of B2B SPA in AWS
responsible for quality and security of delivered end product
responsible for reliability and maintenance of B2B SPA
owning monitoring of end product
responsible for performance of delivered product
delivering work with automation first mind-set
owning CI/CD tools used for delivering end product

The Ideal Candidate:

Skills and Competences
Is inspiring and exudes energy and passion.
Has a keen IT market focus
Is focused on collaboration
Actively seeks help and feedback, but is not afraid to give feedback either.
Is curious and always looks out for innovation opportunities in his/her focus area.
Great Written and verbal communications in English
Self-learning, independent problem-solving skills
Passionate about developer tooling, improving developer experience/workflow

Experience and Specialised Knowledge
Degree in Computer Science or relevant field
4+ years for relevant working experience
4+ years of experience with modern JavaScript, HTML and CSS/SCSS
3+ years of experience with React and Redux
Working experience with TypeScript
Working experience in writing Unit tests
Working experience with Cypress
Working experience with GraphQL
Experience in working with Cloud and AWS
Working experience with Git in collaborative team
Understanding of NodeJS

Nice-to-have
Working experience with EComm
Working experience of building SPA on Websphere Commerce Platform is a plus
Knowledge of web standards and accessibility
Experience with BDD and TDD is a plus
Knowledge of Terraform is a plus
Knowledge of Java is a plus
What You Can Expect from Us:
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities
Please include a cover letter with your application. We would love to know why this is THE role for you!

PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

You communicate with ease to all levels and stakeholders and are able to involve everyone in the process to ensure on time in full delivery.This is our new I/S consultantAs an I/S Consultant you will work closely together with customers and our Zuora consultants to design, develop and deploy custom solutions for our clients. This position requires very strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively with end-users, developers, functional consultants and non-technical teams.Become a subject matter expert in the area of subscriptions.Consult customers with the best practice to integrate the Zuora services.Own and drive customer issues from start to finish.Collaborate on several, concurrent projects, coordinating new releases, or documenting projects.Utilize your excellent problem-solving skills to meet business requirements with technical solutions.This is Subscription FactoryAnd nobody likes a challenge more than Subscription Factory! We are innovators, inventors, developers and managers, first brought together by projects that combined the multiple disciplines essential to the Subscription Economy. We formed Subscription Factory in 2009 and since then we have helped numerous companies to successfully explore and enter the Subscription Economy. We love the challenge and our clients, amongst others Philips, DAF, Trustpilot and Grandvision, have appreciated the results.This is what we needBachelors or Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, finance, accounting business administration, (online) marketing, e-commerce or a related major. (We will also consider technical experience)Previous consulting experience implementing software solutions a plus!Ability to accurately scope, plan and estimate level of effort for tasks, with appropriate balance of risk and effort.Demonstrated strength with complex problem decomposition.Ability to work well with a team of highly talented software professionals in a rapid development environment.Experience in an agile development environment preferred.Very good analytical and problem-solving skills.Effective written and verbal communication skills in both English and Dutch.Willing to work in a fast paced startup environment.Willing to travel within the region.At least 2 years professional experience.Nice to have are experience within SaaS environments, with billing and/or financial enterprise applications, with e-commerce solutions.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:consulting: 1 year (Preferred)professional: 2 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Language:English (Required)Dutch (Required)COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetings

To join its international team in Amsterdam, Bitsafe is seeking to hire aPython Developer32-40 hours per weekBitsafe is the new name for Freenom and Verotel, two disruptive brands in the transactional online business space. Freenom is the world's second largest domain registration provider with over 35 million active internet domain names registered. Verotel is a licensed Electronic Money Institution processing millions of credit card transactions.Bitsafe brings these two brands together into a new service: a Bitsafe Basic Payment Account. Offering a “discreet account”, Bitsafe provides a Bitsafe IBAN allowing account holders to take part in SEPA transactions and store domain names and other digital assets. Purchases and ATM withdrawals can be made with the Bitsafe Debit Card.To help us in building all the systems supporting the Bitsafe offerings, we are looking for a high-performing smart Python Developer. You will be part of a technical team with engineers in all kinds of internet related technology. Bitsafe works in an agile environment and is driven by continual development. Bitsafe's services are built in Python and constantly evolving. Most services are built on top of the Flask framework and run in cloud environments like Kubernetes. The challenge is to keep expanding the services' functionality while keeping the code clean and lean and the services stable and secure.As a Python Developer you are a self-motivated, communicative technologist that thinks all things should be automated. You like to apply new technology, but are not afraid of old concept proven software. You enjoy figuring out why code does not work properly and want to fix the problem. As a Python Developer you are open to learning new things. We want you to understand the entire business from a technical angle so that armed with this knowledge you will be able to build awesome Bitsafe services that everyone is happy to use.Bitsafe is a high-risk payment service provider. Part of Bitsafe's high-risk business is providing payment solutions for online adult entertainment businesses. This means that you need to feel comfortable interacting with the people who run those websites. The regulatory framework around high-risk transaction processing has become very professional and Bitsafe is following and contributing to the rules and regulations set by the card and banking industry.Your responsibilities will be:Build and extend Bitsafe's KYC ("Know Your Customer") and Transaction Monitoring services;Speed up the current platform by redesigning and implementing new parts of it;Port services to the cloud;Work with high load services and figure out how to scale.As a minimum, you:Have a bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required;Have extensive experience in programming Python;Have extensive experience with the Flask framework;Have no problems understanding and fixing code written in PHP/Javascript/Perl;Have extensive experience in writing SQL;Have experience with Unix environments like FreeBSD and Linux;Have experience with AWS and Google Cloud;Have excellent communication skills both verbal and written;Have a residency and work permit in the Netherlands.The ideal candidate:Has an MBA or Masters degree;Has experience in an international business;Has experience in finance industry.What we offer:An international multilingual team in a fast and growing environment;A very competitive salary / pension package;A modern, spacious office in the Houthavens with beautiful view on 'het IJ'.Join us!Are you a natural born shape shifter who enjoys jumping into multiple types of projects across the company? Do you enjoy working within a dynamic, informal and entrepreneurial environment? Then jump onboard and apply today!How to applyPlease send us an email with your motivation letter and CV.We kindly ask recruitment agencies and headhunters to not come with an offer to find qualified candidates for our vacancies.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Python: 1 year (Preferred)

You like to apply new technology, but are not afraid of old concept proven software. You enjoy figuring out why code does not work properly and want to fix the problem. As a Python Developer you are open to learning new things. We want you to understand the entire business from a technical angle so that armed with this knowledge you will be able to build awesome Bitsafe services that everyone is happy to use.Bitsafe is a high-risk payment service provider. Part of Bitsafe's high-risk business is providing payment solutions for online adult entertainment businesses. This means that you need to feel comfortable interacting with the people who run those websites. The regulatory framework around high-risk transaction processing has become very professional and Bitsafe is following and contributing to the rules and regulations set by the card and banking industry.Your responsibilities will be:Build and extend Bitsafe's KYC ("Know Your Customer") and Transaction Monitoring services;Speed up the current platform by redesigning and implementing new parts of it;Port services to the cloud;Work with high load services and figure out how to scale.As a minimum, you:Have a bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required;Have extensive experience in programming Python;Have extensive experience with the Flask framework;Have no problems understanding and fixing code written in PHP/Javascript/Perl;Have extensive experience in writing SQL;Have experience with Unix environments like FreeBSD and Linux;Have experience with AWS and Google Cloud;Have excellent communication skills both verbal and written;Have a residency and work permit in the Netherlands.The ideal candidate:Has an MBA or Masters degree;Has experience in an international business;Has experience in finance industry.What we offer:An international multilingual team in a fast and growing environment;A very competitive salary / pension package;A modern, spacious office in the Houthavens with beautiful view on 'het IJ'.Join us!Are you a natural born shape shifter who enjoys jumping into multiple types of projects across the company? Do you enjoy working within a dynamic, informal and entrepreneurial environment? Then jump onboard and apply today!How to applyPlease send us an email with your motivation letter and CV.We kindly ask recruitment agencies and headhunters to not come with an offer to find qualified candidates for our vacancies.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Python: 1 year (Preferred)

Do you want to contribute to the future of a greener shipping?Est-floattech is now hiring aHardware EngineerEST-Floattech’s mission is to build clean and reliable intelligent energy storage systems to support the energy transition in both the landbased and maritime industry. As a Hardware Engineer, you help to achieve the further growth of EST-Floattech within the changing world of energy storage systems and their applications. In this position you will be mainly focussed on developing our energy storage systems for hybrid and full electric ships. As an international player, EST-FLoattech is looking for an eager Hardware Engineer based in the Netherlands (Hoofddorp).What’s in a day’s work?Idea and concept generation for system improvementSetting up hardware requirementsDesign of schematics and board layouts in Altium DesignerSetup and maintain technical documentationHardware testing and validationGeneration of production filesAlign with other EngineersSecond line supportSelecting manufacturers and suppliers (and supply chain support)What are we are looking for?A Bachelor or Master degree in electrical engineering or similar fieldProven experience in embedded hardware development (3+ years)Experienced in designing Analog, digital, mixed-signal and power circuitsAbility to compile production files like: ODB, Gerber and BoM filesExperience with Altium DesignerExperience in defining product validation plansKnowledge of communication links like CAN bus, SPI, I2C and IP protocolsExperience with Battery Management Systems and embedded software are a plusFluency in English verbally and in writing. Dutch is a plusPersonal qualificationsDetail-orientedIntrinsic motivation to create a sustainable impactA proactive and independent attitudeTeamplayerWhat to expect from us:Excellent market-based salary, based on knowledge and work experienceAn enthusiastic team of colleaguesOpportunity to develop yourself within or outside your field of expertiseInterested?Send your CV and motivation to the attention of Xiomara le Grand, HR Manager. You can also call +31 (0)227 745 511.Contract for 12 monthsDeadline for applicants is 15-04-2021Job Type: ContractSalary: Up to €3,600.00 per monthExperience:embedded hardware development: 3 years (Required)Altium Designer: 2 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Language:English (Required)Dutch (Preferred)Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

As an international player, EST-FLoattech is looking for an eager Hardware Engineer based in the Netherlands (Hoofddorp).What’s in a day’s work?Idea and concept generation for system improvementSetting up hardware requirementsDesign of schematics and board layouts in Altium DesignerSetup and maintain technical documentationHardware testing and validationGeneration of production filesAlign with other EngineersSecond line supportSelecting manufacturers and suppliers (and supply chain support)What are we are looking for?A Bachelor or Master degree in electrical engineering or similar fieldProven experience in embedded hardware development (3+ years)Experienced in designing Analog, digital, mixed-signal and power circuitsAbility to compile production files like: ODB, Gerber and BoM filesExperience with Altium DesignerExperience in defining product validation plansKnowledge of communication links like CAN bus, SPI, I2C and IP protocolsExperience with Battery Management Systems and embedded software are a plusFluency in English verbally and in writing. Dutch is a plusPersonal qualificationsDetail-orientedIntrinsic motivation to create a sustainable impactA proactive and independent attitudeTeamplayerWhat to expect from us:Excellent market-based salary, based on knowledge and work experienceAn enthusiastic team of colleaguesOpportunity to develop yourself within or outside your field of expertiseInterested?Send your CV and motivation to the attention of Xiomara le Grand, HR Manager. About this roleYou’ll be part of a DevOps team that continuously strives to improve on our products and delivery process. Experimentation, automation and freedom is in our DNA. Automate builds, tests, releases and documentation are important to us as we are not fans of repetitive tasks. Allowing your creativity and quality delivery skills to thrive.You will build, work and integrate with complex systems. Prototyping and proof-of-concept projects will also be part of your job. You will work on developing our own Xillio products which may include external system investigation and integration.Our technology stack consists of NodeJS, Java (Spring) and Docker. For our frontends we use React. We regularly examine our choices to find better ways, tools or languages and encourage you to become part of that journey.What you’ll bring to be successfulYou will have a bachelor or a master degree in computer science, software engineering or relevant working experience;You will have multiple years of experience in NodeJS, React, and preferably Java EE, ideally Spring including Spring Boot and Spring security;Knowledge and experience of DevOps delivery will be a benefit;You’re a fast learner with the ability to dive into other code and architecture;You are a person able to multitask and have effective written and oral communication skills;Knowledge of the content management and content migration domain is a pre;You have a healthy sense of business;Fluent in English and based in The Netherlands.About XillioXillio, the world's leading content migration and integration company, provides technology and services to help organizations get the best value out of their content. Xillio has completed 200+ projects. Xillio is proud to partner up with some of the largest system integrators and specialized local implementation companies. Xillio was recognized as a Cool Vendor in Content Services in 2017 by Gartner and in 2020 we achieved to become a Preferred Member of Microsoft Content Services Partner Program. We have offices in The Netherlands, UK and US.Xillio is headquartered in an office villa located in a beautiful green part of Hilversum on the ‘s-Gravelandseweg 178, 1217 GB in The Netherlands.Xillio offers youA chance to work on in-house development of state-of-the-art solutions. You can take part or even lead in (remote) national and international and complex software development projects and set the standard in the "new way of working".We offer an excellent employment package and training opportunities.Our team consists of smart, creative, persistent and funny developers and consultants who enjoy playing chess, games and bootcamp next to their work.How to apply and what to expect in our recruitment processLet's conquer the market together. Upload your CV and short motivation letter via the 'Apply now' form. For questions you can contact our development team lead Daan Gosman via 035-6229545.Unfortunately, this opportunity does not provide a visa sponsorship or a work permit for non-EU citizens. All applicants outside the Netherlands will not be taken into consideration.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Software Engineering: 4 years (Preferred)Language:English (Required)Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

To provide advice and guidance at regional/divisional level and effectively manage a team of professionals and/or subject matter experts. Responsibilities may include interfacing with Corporate level management.
Significant experience in building Big Data systems using technologies like Databricks, Azure, etc.
Experience in the technical design and development of major data processing projects.
Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree/equivalent in computer science, math or directly related quantitative Degree or related field.
Technical leadership in design, implementation and support of large scale data and analytics solutions that are highly reliable, flexible, and scalable.
Extremely strong technical background with the capability of being hands-on if required and earn the respect and ability to mentor top individual technical talent.
Develop the long-term strategy for your programs and translate that into an achievable roadmap/action plan
Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments
Manage the day-to-day activities of the development team within an Agile/Scrum environment
Build and manage a team of data engineers, data architects.
Recruit, hire, mentor, and coach technical staff
Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach.
Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management
Manage the collaboration with multiple vendors both on and off shore.
The ideal candidate will have:
BS or MS in computer science/computer engineering or equivalent
8+ years of industry experience as a software engineer
2+ years of industry experience as a software engineering manager or leadership experience
Strong fundamentals in computer science and RDBMS fundamentals.
Deep hands-on technical expertise
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong business and technical vision
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
A deep understanding of software development in a team, and a track record of shipping software on time
Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions
A track record of communicating well with executives and non-technical leaders.
Leadership Skills;Planning & Organizing Skills;Judgement & Decision Making Skills;Influencing & Persuasion Skills;Presentation Skills;
FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
Our Company
FedEx Express is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
Our Philosophy
The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
Our Culture
Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

Significant experience in building Big Data systems using technologies like Databricks, Azure, etc.
Experience in the technical design and development of major data processing projects.
Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree/equivalent in computer science, math or directly related quantitative Degree or related field.
Technical leadership in design, implementation and support of large scale data and analytics solutions that are highly reliable, flexible, and scalable.
Extremely strong technical background with the capability of being hands-on if required and earn the respect and ability to mentor top individual technical talent.
Develop the long-term strategy for your programs and translate that into an achievable roadmap/action plan
Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments
Manage the day-to-day activities of the development team within an Agile/Scrum environment
Build and manage a team of data engineers, data architects.
Recruit, hire, mentor, and coach technical staff
Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach.
Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management
Manage the collaboration with multiple vendors both on and off shore.
The ideal candidate will have:
BS or MS in computer science/computer engineering or equivalent
8+ years of industry experience as a software engineer
2+ years of industry experience as a software engineering manager or leadership experience
Strong fundamentals in computer science and RDBMS fundamentals.
Deep hands-on technical expertise
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong business and technical vision
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
A deep understanding of software development in a team, and a track record of shipping software on time
Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions
A track record of communicating well with executives and non-technical leaders.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
Our Company
FedEx Express is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
Our Philosophy
The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
Our Culture
Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

Introduction

INKEF Capital is an innovative venture capital firm dedicated to supporting European early-stage companies in both the technology and healthcare/life sciences sectors. We are distinct from other funds in that our 20-year fund life and €500 million fund size allow us to be true a partner for the longer term, supporting ventures through their different stages of development.
With 12 investment professionals, the INKEF team has a multidisciplinary set of backgrounds in complementary technical and operational fields as well as geographies, which enables us to provide a rounded, international perspective and broad network to ensure that our portfolio companies reach their full global potential. Our fund has made over 40 investments across Europe and realized 6 exits resulting already in a top decile performance. Anticipating on our near term future expansion and ambitions, we are looking to expand the team further.

As a key next step in our journey, INKEF is looking to hire a Senior Associate to strengthen its technology team. We are looking for someone with passion for technology and keen interest in analyzing underlying architectures and evaluating companies’ technological choices, which forms a critical part of our investment decision. Moreover, the ideal candidate should be able to lead transactions largely autonomously and win the hearts of founders, while being able to secure the buy-in from senior members of the INKEF team. For exceptional candidates there will be a fast track perspective towards Principal level.

Job Description Technology Senior Associate


Pro-active involvement in deal sourcing & deal flow management. You will be responsible for setting the heartbeat of the fund in terms of deal sourcing.
Help expand our data-driven models to deal flow and portfolio hiring
Maintaining & Building out a network for proprietary deal sourcing with entrepreneurs and fellow VCs by attending (international) events, social events, dinners and meet-ups.
Due diligence of new ventures, analyze markets and competitive environments, evaluate and benchmark business models, metrics and technology stack.
Performing deep dives into technology areas that could be of interest to INKEF and markets to determine future investment thesis.
Active involvement in supporting INKEF’s current and future portfolio companies on strategic matters and new corporate actions (i.e. add-on acquisitions, future fundraising efforts, etc.)
The Senior Associate, as prospective board observer with portfolio companies, is expected to be “ahead of the curve” in terms of his/her understanding of portfolio companies (and their respective competitive environment under his/her watch).
Preparing internal investment memos, including valuation analysis via modelling.

Qualifications

Graduated from a top tier university, ideally an MSc in basic or applied science (computer science, physics, mathematics, econometrics etc.),
We believe that an eligible candidate has a minimum of 4 years and maximum 8 of years of relevant experience, ideally from product or technology roles, technology consulting, or has seen the inside of a tech startup. Candidates with a strong finance or strategy consulting background will also be considered. However, in all cases, prior experience in the venture capital space would be a very big plus,
High degree of intellectual curiosity and excellent work ethics,
Outstanding analytical skills, attention to detail, pro-active and self-motivated,
An ability to build and maintain good relationships with people,
Is a driven self-starter, needs little guidance and takes ownership,
Strong written and verbal communication skills,
A multicultural background is a plus, you have explored the world and ideally speak more than two languages,
High level of energy, enthusiasm, and commitment to success.

Benefits


Amazing on-the-job learning opportunities as a key member of our investment team with significant mentorship from the INKEF team,
A highly international working environment with fun but high-performing colleagues,
A chance to work with exceptional entrepreneurs,
Competitive base salary,
Bonus/upside in the fund performance,
Discounted premium gym membership,
A very competitive “upskilling” budget to attend relevant external courses of choice (finance, strategy, machine learning, software engineering etc.)

Start date

As soon as possible

Posting statement

INKEF Capital is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. INKEF Capital does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. INKEF Capital will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with INKEF Capital.

Introduction

INKEF Capital is an innovative venture capital firm dedicated to supporting European early-stage companies in both the technology and healthcare/life sciences sectors. We are distinct from other funds in that our 20-year fund life and €500 million fund size allow us to be true a partner for the longer term, supporting ventures through their different stages of development.
With 12 investment professionals, the INKEF team has a multidisciplinary set of backgrounds in complementary technical and operational fields as well as geographies, which enables us to provide a rounded, international perspective and broad network to ensure that our portfolio companies reach their full global potential. Our fund has made over 40 investments across Europe and realized 6 exits resulting already in a top decile performance. Anticipating on our near term future expansion and ambitions, we are looking to expand the team further.

As a key next step in our journey, INKEF is looking to hire a Senior Associate to strengthen its technology team. We are looking for someone with passion for technology and keen interest in analyzing underlying architectures and evaluating companies’ technological choices, which forms a critical part of our investment decision. Moreover, the ideal candidate should be able to lead transactions largely autonomously and win the hearts of founders, while being able to secure the buy-in from senior members of the INKEF team. For exceptional candidates there will be a fast track perspective towards Principal level.

Job Description Technology Senior Associate


Pro-active involvement in deal sourcing & deal flow management. You will be responsible for setting the heartbeat of the fund in terms of deal sourcing.
Help expand our data-driven models to deal flow and portfolio hiring
Maintaining & Building out a network for proprietary deal sourcing with entrepreneurs and fellow VCs by attending (international) events, social events, dinners and meet-ups.
Due diligence of new ventures, analyze markets and competitive environments, evaluate and benchmark business models, metrics and technology stack.
Performing deep dives into technology areas that could be of interest to INKEF and markets to determine future investment thesis.
Active involvement in supporting INKEF’s current and future portfolio companies on strategic matters and new corporate actions (i.e. add-on acquisitions, future fundraising efforts, etc.)
The Senior Associate, as prospective board observer with portfolio companies, is expected to be “ahead of the curve” in terms of his/her understanding of portfolio companies (and their respective competitive environment under his/her watch).
Preparing internal investment memos, including valuation analysis via modelling.

Candidates with a strong finance or strategy consulting background will also be considered. However, in all cases, prior experience in the venture capital space would be a very big plus,
High degree of intellectual curiosity and excellent work ethics,
Outstanding analytical skills, attention to detail, pro-active and self-motivated,
An ability to build and maintain good relationships with people,
Is a driven self-starter, needs little guidance and takes ownership,
Strong written and verbal communication skills,
A multicultural background is a plus, you have explored the world and ideally speak more than two languages,
High level of energy, enthusiasm, and commitment to success.

Performing deep dives into technology areas that could be of interest to INKEF and markets to determine future investment thesis.
Active involvement in supporting INKEF’s current and future portfolio companies on strategic matters and new corporate actions (i.e. add-on acquisitions, future fundraising efforts, etc.)
The Senior Associate, as prospective board observer with portfolio companies, is expected to be “ahead of the curve” in terms of his/her understanding of portfolio companies (and their respective competitive environment under his/her watch).
Preparing internal investment memos, including valuation analysis via modelling.

Qualifications

Graduated from a top tier university, ideally an MSc in basic or applied science (computer science, physics, mathematics, econometrics etc.),
We believe that an eligible candidate has a minimum of 4 years and maximum 8 of years of relevant experience, ideally from product or technology roles, technology consulting, or has seen the inside of a tech startup. Candidates with a strong finance or strategy consulting background will also be considered. However, in all cases, prior experience in the venture capital space would be a very big plus,
High degree of intellectual curiosity and excellent work ethics,
Outstanding analytical skills, attention to detail, pro-active and self-motivated,
An ability to build and maintain good relationships with people,
Is a driven self-starter, needs little guidance and takes ownership,
Strong written and verbal communication skills,
A multicultural background is a plus, you have explored the world and ideally speak more than two languages,
High level of energy, enthusiasm, and commitment to success.

Benefits


Amazing on-the-job learning opportunities as a key member of our investment team with significant mentorship from the INKEF team,
A highly international working environment with fun but high-performing colleagues,
A chance to work with exceptional entrepreneurs,
Competitive base salary,
Bonus/upside in the fund performance,
Discounted premium gym membership,
A very competitive “upskilling” budget to attend relevant external courses of choice (finance, strategy, machine learning, software engineering etc.)

Start date

As soon as possible

Posting statement

INKEF Capital is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. INKEF Capital does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. INKEF Capital will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with INKEF Capital.

Introduction

INKEF Capital is an innovative venture capital firm dedicated to supporting European early-stage companies in both the technology and healthcare/life sciences sectors. We are distinct from other funds in that our 20-year fund life and €500 million fund size allow us to be true a partner for the longer term, supporting ventures through their different stages of development.
With 12 investment professionals, the INKEF team has a multidisciplinary set of backgrounds in complementary technical and operational fields as well as geographies, which enables us to provide a rounded, international perspective and broad network to ensure that our portfolio companies reach their full global potential. Our fund has made over 40 investments across Europe and realized 6 exits resulting already in a top decile performance. Anticipating on our near term future expansion and ambitions, we are looking to expand the team further.

As a key next step in our journey, INKEF is looking to hire a Senior Associate to strengthen its technology team. We are looking for someone with passion for technology and keen interest in analyzing underlying architectures and evaluating companies’ technological choices, which forms a critical part of our investment decision. Moreover, the ideal candidate should be able to lead transactions largely autonomously and win the hearts of founders, while being able to secure the buy-in from senior members of the INKEF team. For exceptional candidates there will be a fast track perspective towards Principal level.

Job Description Technology Senior Associate


Pro-active involvement in deal sourcing & deal flow management. You will be responsible for setting the heartbeat of the fund in terms of deal sourcing.
Help expand our data-driven models to deal flow and portfolio hiring
Maintaining & Building out a network for proprietary deal sourcing with entrepreneurs and fellow VCs by attending (international) events, social events, dinners and meet-ups.
Due diligence of new ventures, analyze markets and competitive environments, evaluate and benchmark business models, metrics and technology stack.
Performing deep dives into technology areas that could be of interest to INKEF and markets to determine future investment thesis.
Active involvement in supporting INKEF’s current and future portfolio companies on strategic matters and new corporate actions (i.e. add-on acquisitions, future fundraising efforts, etc.)
The Senior Associate, as prospective board observer with portfolio companies, is expected to be “ahead of the curve” in terms of his/her understanding of portfolio companies (and their respective competitive environment under his/her watch).
Preparing internal investment memos, including valuation analysis via modelling.

Qualifications

Graduated from a top tier university, ideally an MSc in basic or applied science (computer science, physics, mathematics, econometrics etc.),
We believe that an eligible candidate has a minimum of 4 years and maximum 8 of years of relevant experience, ideally from product or technology roles, technology consulting, or has seen the inside of a tech startup. Candidates with a strong finance or strategy consulting background will also be considered. However, in all cases, prior experience in the venture capital space would be a very big plus,
High degree of intellectual curiosity and excellent work ethics,
Outstanding analytical skills, attention to detail, pro-active and self-motivated,
An ability to build and maintain good relationships with people,
Is a driven self-starter, needs little guidance and takes ownership,
Strong written and verbal communication skills,
A multicultural background is a plus, you have explored the world and ideally speak more than two languages,
High level of energy, enthusiasm, and commitment to success.

Benefits


Amazing on-the-job learning opportunities as a key member of our investment team with significant mentorship from the INKEF team,
A highly international working environment with fun but high-performing colleagues,
A chance to work with exceptional entrepreneurs,
Competitive base salary,
Bonus/upside in the fund performance,
Discounted premium gym membership,
A very competitive “upskilling” budget to attend relevant external courses of choice (finance, strategy, machine learning, software engineering etc.)

Start date

As soon as possible

Hoofddorp - As a Python developer at NU.nl you contribute to the biggest digital news brand in the Netherlands, with a monthly reach of more than seven million Dutch people. The impact you make is huge and contributes directly to the user experience.
What are you going to do?

In this role you are responsible for the devops and backend part of NU.nl. You are closely involved with the product. Together with your colleagues you improve, maintain and add new features to the NU.nl backend. Between sprints, you do refinements and search for new opportunities, tools and techniques to improve the product. You also continuously search for ways to improve the software development process. Your main tasks exist of:

The development of various services that power NU.nl.
DevOps-related improvements to the NU.nl stack.
Looking for opportunities to improve the product and process.
Collaborating with other teams and gaining and sharing knowledge.

The team

NU.nl has several development teams. A team consists of a product owner, several developers, a designer, tester and scrum master. In sprints of 2 to 3 weeks you work closely together on the optimization of our product. The various departments, including editorial, marketing, IT and the product team, each contribute an essential part to the total experience. The NU.nl team is ambitious and talented, with passion and pleasure anchored in the DNA of NU.nl.
We offer

An experience-based salary.
36-hour workweek.
Company laptop and/or phone.
12% in flexible benefits (of which 8% is holiday allowance).
Working with the latest stack.
24 paid holiday days.
A percentage of profit shares.
Fully paid functional technical training.
Knowledge sharing from our tech colleagues.

Even more reasons to work at DPG Media

At DPG Media, we work for more than 90 strong news brands, magazines, television shows, radio stations, and online services such as Qmusic, NU.nl, Tweakers, Libelle, and VTM. Although we look like a media group, we are really a tech company. We get digital transformation done.

We offer a high-performing tech workplace where we treasure freedom, from how you find solutions to choosing your path. Feel free to be an entrepreneur, an apprentice, a team player, and, of course, to be you. We welcome everyone to apply, whatever your background may be. A great bunch of smart colleagues awaits you and are eager for you to join the team, whether that be a project team, a pub quiz team, or a sports team.

Learn what we have to offer you or get to know our tech company! And while you’re at it, you can find us on LinkedIn and Twitter too.



Job requirements

You have 5+ years of experience as a Python developer.
You have experience with the Django and Django Rest Frameworks. Knowledge of cloud (AWS) and Kubernetes is a plus.
In addition to your knowledge of Python, you have additional experience with Docker, GraphQL, Node.js or Vue.js.
You have experience with various CI/CD-related tools. Experience with infra-as-code is a plus.
You work agile, test-driven, consistent and with an eye for detail.
As the largest media company in the Netherlands, we are open to all talents in our society. We call on candidates with a diverse background - in the broadest sense of the word - to apply for this position. It’s the differences between colleagues that lead to surprising insights and innovative solutions. And that, in turn, fits very well with us as an organization. We are curious about you, your qualities, and your experience.
Will you be our new colleague? Then apply now!

Want to know more first? I would be happy to answer your questions via mark.van.dommelen@dpgmedia.nl. You can also call or send an app to +316 83 80 00 59.
We prefer to do our recruitment ourselves and do not need any help with this.

Hoofddorp - As a Python developer at NU.nl you contribute to the biggest digital news brand in the Netherlands, with a monthly reach of more than seven million Dutch people. The impact you make is huge and contributes directly to the user experience.
What are you going to do?

In this role you are responsible for the devops and backend part of NU.nl. You are closely involved with the product. Together with your colleagues you improve, maintain and add new features to the NU.nl backend. Between sprints, you do refinements and search for new opportunities, tools and techniques to improve the product. You also continuously search for ways to improve the software development process. Your main tasks exist of:

The development of various services that power NU.nl.
DevOps-related improvements to the NU.nl stack.
Looking for opportunities to improve the product and process.
Collaborating with other teams and gaining and sharing knowledge.

The team

NU.nl has several development teams. A team consists of a product owner, several developers, a designer, tester and scrum master. In sprints of 2 to 3 weeks you work closely together on the optimization of our product. The various departments, including editorial, marketing, IT and the product team, each contribute an essential part to the total experience. The NU.nl team is ambitious and talented, with passion and pleasure anchored in the DNA of NU.nl.
We offer

An experience-based salary.
36-hour workweek.
Company laptop and/or phone.
12% in flexible benefits (of which 8% is holiday allowance).
Working with the latest stack.
24 paid holiday days.
A percentage of profit shares.
Fully paid functional technical training.
Knowledge sharing from our tech colleagues.

Qardio is on a mission to make heart health better, smarter and easier for everyone. As a leading brand in the digital health and technology sector, we are hiring an ambitious Front-End Developer to join our team.
Role
Our world-leading consumer healthcare and medical products bring the potential to transform healthcare for millions of people. We are looking for a hardworking, self-motivated individual, with an acute eye for detail and a passion for applications to be part of the engineering team.
The Senior Front End Developer, who is a JavaScript enthusiast and passionate about AngularJS, CSS3, and HTML5, will be responsible for developing, deploying, and managing our innovative web applications.
Your Responsibilities
Provide exceptional programming and analytical skills to develop and maintain a highly visible, responsive web application
Exercise cross-disciplinary skills to include security testing, unit testing, and performance tuning and testing
Interact confidently and enthusiastically with a highly distributed and diverse team
Value product excellence and team success over individual productivity
Essential skills and experience
5+ years of experience as a Front End Developer
Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent field
Experience in developing web-based data visualization and analytic platforms using JavaScript (TypeScript), React, AngularJS, Single Page Applications (SPAs), Node Package Manager (NPM), and REST APIs.
Fluent in JavaScript and Typescript (ES6+)
Experience with HTML5,Canvas CSS3, SASS and D3
Experience with AngularJS
Hands-on experience on React Components, Event Handling, React Hooks, Routers
Experience with unit testing frameworks such as Jest, React-testing-library
Good exposure and understanding of Material UI Design and Angular Material
Front-end development tools such as webpack, babel, and yarn
Experience with Unit Testing, TDD, Automated Testing, or End to End testing is a plus
Experience with source control (Git preferred)
Experience with Agile/Scrum software development
Strong written and oral communication skills in English
Bonus points for
Experience working on hybrid web applications using multiple frameworks simultaneously (e.g.: AngularJs/ReactJS/VueJS)
Experience in implementing D3 charts from complex data structures and improving performance using canvas.
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment
What we offer
A competitive salary, depending on your knowledge and experience.
Employee health insurance discount
Personal development budget
Flexible work-hours & 25 days of leave annually
The opportunity to work in an international environment working with others from different cultures, countries and backgrounds
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Visa sponsorship

PPgCggNFEg

Qardio is on a mission to make heart health better, smarter and easier for everyone. As a leading brand in the digital health and technology sector, we are hiring an ambitious Front-End Developer to join our team.
Role
Our world-leading consumer healthcare and medical products bring the potential to transform healthcare for millions of people. We are looking for a hardworking, self-motivated individual, with an acute eye for detail and a passion for applications to be part of the engineering team.
The Senior Front End Developer, who is a JavaScript enthusiast and passionate about AngularJS, CSS3, and HTML5, will be responsible for developing, deploying, and managing our innovative web applications.
Your Responsibilities
Provide exceptional programming and analytical skills to develop and maintain a highly visible, responsive web application
Exercise cross-disciplinary skills to include security testing, unit testing, and performance tuning and testing
Interact confidently and enthusiastically with a highly distributed and diverse team
Value product excellence and team success over individual productivity
Essential skills and experience
5+ years of experience as a Front End Developer
Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent field
Experience in developing web-based data visualization and analytic platforms using JavaScript (TypeScript), React, AngularJS, Single Page Applications (SPAs), Node Package Manager (NPM), and REST APIs.
Fluent in JavaScript and Typescript (ES6+)
Experience with HTML5,Canvas CSS3, SASS and D3
Experience with AngularJS
Hands-on experience on React Components, Event Handling, React Hooks, Routers
Experience with unit testing frameworks such as Jest, React-testing-library
Good exposure and understanding of Material UI Design and Angular Material
Front-end development tools such as webpack, babel, and yarn
Experience with Unit Testing, TDD, Automated Testing, or End to End testing is a plus
Experience with source control (Git preferred)
Experience with Agile/Scrum software development
Strong written and oral communication skills in English
Bonus points for
Experience working on hybrid web applications using multiple frameworks simultaneously (e.g.: AngularJs/ReactJS/VueJS)
Experience in implementing D3 charts from complex data structures and improving performance using canvas.
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment
What we offer
A competitive salary, depending on your knowledge and experience.
Employee health insurance discount
Personal development budget
Flexible work-hours & 25 days of leave annually
The opportunity to work in an international environment working with others from different cultures, countries and backgrounds
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Visa sponsorship

PPgCggNFEg

Job scope:

Saxo Bank offers several award-winning online platforms and APIs to retail and institutional traders and investors globally. We offer execution across a wide range of assets including Stocks, ETFs, CFDs, Forex, Options, Futures, Funds, Warrants, Turbos and Bonds, all from a single consolidated account as well as a full suite of back office services.

We are now looking for a Product Manager who can help us realize our ambitious strategy by owning and defining the roadmap for our cutting-edge asset management solution servicing clients globally across desktop, tablet and mobile devices.

As our new Product Manager, you will join a highly motivated and successful team where you will focus on the development and positioning of our new asset management offering across all our existing platforms: SaxoInvestor, SaxoTraderGO and SaxoTraderPRO.

You'll be equally adept at collaborating with development teams and business stakeholders as well as presenting to sales and marketing and soliciting feedback from clients directly.

You'll also have excellent interpersonal skills as they are essential in order to effectively collaborate with other internal teams. We need someone with the ability to approach challenges with creativity and enthusiasm; someone who has the courage to innovate and advocate for change and then deliver on those proposals. We'll expect you to influence the overall product vision, and then execute on that vision in our Agile development environment.

You will be reporting to the Head of Wealth Management Platforms.

Your responsibility:

Participate in defining the Value Proposition for asset management and help drive the delivery of the enhanced client experience.
In coordination with the Head of Wealth Management Platforms and all stakeholders across the value chain, drive the development process of the new solution.
Help coordinate the migration of existing asset management client base to the new asset management proposition.
Support the global rollout of the offering, both to Saxo Bank's direct clients (B2C) and through the WL version (B2B2C) of the offering.
Support initiatives to constantly improve the Asset Management offering across the value chain.
Prioritize development of new features and ancillary services both on a tactical and strategic level, ensuring that the solution remains scalable on a global level.
Work closely with Sales and Marketing teams to support the go-to-market and targeted local marketing campaigns.
Always ensure that the offering is fully compliant, considering target market and MIFID II rules.

Required skills and competences:

Ability to work independently and handle the challenges that span across the value chain.
Strong problem solving skills, ownership and a willingness to make sure the job gets done.
Solid technical/business analyst background with a strong understanding of software development process in the Agile development framework.
Working experience in fund/asset management, both from a client-facing and regulatory perspective, is a must.
Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a sophisticated organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

We offer:

A chance to join a truly growth-embracing culture, which will commit to helping you grow personally and professionally.
An opportunity to work as part of a dynamic, very ambitious and, at the same time, informal and pleasant working environment.
An attractive salary plus benefits package.

Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a sophisticated organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

We offer:

A chance to join a truly growth-embracing culture, which will commit to helping you grow personally and professionally.
An opportunity to work as part of a dynamic, very ambitious and, at the same time, informal and pleasant working environment.
An attractive salary plus benefits package.

Job scope:

Saxo Bank offers several award-winning online platforms and APIs to retail and institutional traders and investors globally. We offer execution across a wide range of assets including Stocks, ETFs, CFDs, Forex, Options, Futures, Funds, Warrants, Turbos and Bonds, all from a single consolidated account as well as a full suite of back office services.

We are now looking for a Product Manager who can help us realize our ambitious strategy by owning and defining the roadmap for our cutting-edge asset management solution servicing clients globally across desktop, tablet and mobile devices.

As our new Product Manager, you will join a highly motivated and successful team where you will focus on the development and positioning of our new asset management offering across all our existing platforms: SaxoInvestor, SaxoTraderGO and SaxoTraderPRO.

You'll be equally adept at collaborating with development teams and business stakeholders as well as presenting to sales and marketing and soliciting feedback from clients directly.

You'll also have excellent interpersonal skills as they are essential in order to effectively collaborate with other internal teams. We need someone with the ability to approach challenges with creativity and enthusiasm; someone who has the courage to innovate and advocate for change and then deliver on those proposals. We'll expect you to influence the overall product vision, and then execute on that vision in our Agile development environment.

You will be reporting to the Head of Wealth Management Platforms.

Your responsibility:

Participate in defining the Value Proposition for asset management and help drive the delivery of the enhanced client experience.
In coordination with the Head of Wealth Management Platforms and all stakeholders across the value chain, drive the development process of the new solution.
Help coordinate the migration of existing asset management client base to the new asset management proposition.
Support the global rollout of the offering, both to Saxo Bank's direct clients (B2C) and through the WL version (B2B2C) of the offering.
Support initiatives to constantly improve the Asset Management offering across the value chain.
Prioritize development of new features and ancillary services both on a tactical and strategic level, ensuring that the solution remains scalable on a global level.
Work closely with Sales and Marketing teams to support the go-to-market and targeted local marketing campaigns.
Always ensure that the offering is fully compliant, considering target market and MIFID II rules.

Required skills and competences:

Ability to work independently and handle the challenges that span across the value chain.
Strong problem solving skills, ownership and a willingness to make sure the job gets done.
Solid technical/business analyst background with a strong understanding of software development process in the Agile development framework.
Working experience in fund/asset management, both from a client-facing and regulatory perspective, is a must.
Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a sophisticated organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

We offer:

A chance to join a truly growth-embracing culture, which will commit to helping you grow personally and professionally.
An opportunity to work as part of a dynamic, very ambitious and, at the same time, informal and pleasant working environment.
An attractive salary plus benefits package.

Role Description:
You'll be responsible for helping DevOps teams to automate and accelerate software development via CI / CD.
Have knowledge about tooling and affinity with AWS, Python, Artifactory, Gitlab life cycle management and the CI/CD principles
Experienced in software development

Possess recent experience with AZURE, CI/CD and the Agile way of working
Experienced in Sonar, Gitlab and Artifactory
Have experience with automation and monitoring tools
Have worked in the past as consultant, coach or trainer, which would be a pre
Have knowledge about Azure DevOps

Job Type Contract

Location Amsterdam

Area Netherlands

Sector Software Development

Salary £440 - 530 per day

Start Date ASAP

Job Ref CPDSHAO

Description

The Task:
Templeton and Partners Limited is currently looking for an experienced Python developer in Amsterdam, NL.
Initial contract is 3 months with extension.
A diverse skill set is required to manage the complexities of seamlessly including new workflows into an already complex and feature-rich application platform.
In addition to restructuring core application components (which make use of Machine Learning and other data-analytics techniques) extensions to the user interface have to be developed that grant user access to the external based data processing and analytics tools.
Most of the development effort will focus on the Python based data analytics tool and requires advanced Python skills, OO development in Python and in-depth knowledge about writing high performing numerical Python code.
Detailed knowledge about the numpy, scipy, scikit-learn and TensorFlow packages is highly recommended.
Key Responsibilities:

Effectively and enthusiastically participate in executing the work program (backlog) of the project team.Work effectively in a complex, large and diverse Python code base to build robust software components.
Work with end users to capture feedback and opportunities for further improvement of the solution.Work effectively and using agile methodology in a medium sized SCRUM team; build effective relations with key stakeholders and tool/domain experts.
Skills and competencies:
5+ year experience with Python and OO programming (to be assessed via online coding test).2+ year experience of writing high performing numerical Python code using libraries like numpy, scipy and numba.2+ year experience of working with scitkit-learn and TensorFlow or comparable frameworks.Expertise in writing platform independent Python UI code for Windows and Linux using QT/TraitsUIExperience with software development methodologies (e.g. Agile/SCRUM, ATDD).Knowledge of and affinity with data analytics techniques as implemented in the scikit-learn and TensorFlow packages.Experience with C# is beneficial.Knowledge of industry best practices in development.Knowledge in using and developing applicable tool sets (AzureDevOps, GIT, GitHub, …).Ability to work well with internal and external technology stakeholders and resources.Good oral and written communications skills.

Are you passionate about Java and Big Data technologies and do you enjoy designing and developing systems that are reliable at scale and flexible to product innovations? Do you like to address complex architectural problems with simple and intuitive designs, while being able to communicate technical ideas and direction across the organisation? Our product development is expanding and looking for a Senior Software Engineer!

Who is Relay42?

Relay42 has grown from a start-up to a champion in data marketing technology in Europe. We help top brands achieve a 360-degree view of their customers by connecting all data points and personalizing 1 to 1 communication across all channels and devices in a scalable way. We have become a market leader in the Netherlands, and we are now connecting the rest of the world.

Your role:

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be involved in designing and developing systems that are reliable, scalable and flexible to product innovations. You assure that the code quality is high and consistent. Your passion for technology makes you a true master in not only Java but also in Big Data technologies, all of which while thinking in a completely cloud-native mindset. As part of the product development team, you love to address complex architectural problems with simple and intuitive design, while being able to communicate technical ideas and direction across the organisation. You will work on new projects such as Orchestration Engine or Cloud Data Connector and you will be involved in improving the battle-tested parts of the Relay42’s Data Management Platform.

Working on delivery of our product (80%)
Design and develop systems which are cloud-native, reliable and globally scalable
Code review the work of your teammates to ensure high code quality
Making sure the systems run smoothly in production

Being part of team development (20%)
Continuously help to improve on team process
Mentorship for less senior members
Knowledge sharing
What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate has experience working in a professional product driven environment. The candidate is a true expert in Java but has also good knowledge of Cassandra, Kafka and can communicate with technical and non-technical people. The candidate is passionate about high code quality and will be almost exclusively involved with backend and infrastructural tasks. The candidate is known to evangelize best practices and knows how to properly introduce new technologies to an existing architecture. Furthermore, the candidate takes CI/CD pipelines and performance testing seriously and makes sure that the piece of code is covered with unit and integration tests such as Selenium and Protractor testing.

Expected

6+ years of experience working in a professional product-driven environment
Experience with the Java, Spring Ecosystem
Experience with Big Data stack (ex. Cassandra, Kafka)
Experience with Version control systems (Git)
Experience with Unix / Linux
Experience with the full deployment cycle

Preferred

Experience with the Atlassian stack (Jira, Confluence)
Experience with AWS Cloud
Experience with Scrum/Kanban

What’s in it for you:

Competitive salary and great benefits. Working with a highly motivated team and last but not least, the opportunity to work in an informal environment with ample opportunities for professional development on projects that impact millions of consumers worldwide.

Pioneering entrepreneurial atmosphere
Training, conferences and personal development opportunities
Working for one of the fastest growing CDP +Journey Orchestration platforms in Europe
A fun, dynamic workplace with everything from ping pong and foosball to a comfy relaxation room

Communal lunch & Healthy and less healthy snacks all day long
Weekly bootcamp on location
Flexible working hours and workspace
A fun and connected community with monthly and quarterly meetings/events & Innovation week
Pension scheme
