Working for one of the fastest growing CDP +Journey Orchestration platforms in Europe
A fun, dynamic workplace with everything from ping pong and foosball to a comfy relaxation room

Communal lunch & Healthy and less healthy snacks all day long
Weekly bootcamp on location
Flexible working hours and workspace
A fun and connected community with monthly and quarterly meetings/events & Innovation week
Pension scheme

Are you passionate about Java and Big Data technologies and do you enjoy designing and developing systems that are reliable at scale and flexible to product innovations? Do you like to address complex architectural problems with simple and intuitive designs, while being able to communicate technical ideas and direction across the organisation? Our product development is expanding and looking for a Senior Software Engineer!

Who is Relay42?

Relay42 has grown from a start-up to a champion in data marketing technology in Europe. We help top brands achieve a 360-degree view of their customers by connecting all data points and personalizing 1 to 1 communication across all channels and devices in a scalable way. We have become a market leader in the Netherlands, and we are now connecting the rest of the world.

Your role:

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be involved in designing and developing systems that are reliable, scalable and flexible to product innovations. You assure that the code quality is high and consistent. Your passion for technology makes you a true master in not only Java but also in Big Data technologies, all of which while thinking in a completely cloud-native mindset. As part of the product development team, you love to address complex architectural problems with simple and intuitive design, while being able to communicate technical ideas and direction across the organisation. You will work on new projects such as Orchestration Engine or Cloud Data Connector and you will be involved in improving the battle-tested parts of the Relay42’s Data Management Platform.

Working on delivery of our product (80%)
Design and develop systems which are cloud-native, reliable and globally scalable
Code review the work of your teammates to ensure high code quality
Making sure the systems run smoothly in production

Being part of team development (20%)
Continuously help to improve on team process
Mentorship for less senior members
Knowledge sharing
What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate has experience working in a professional product driven environment. The candidate is a true expert in Java but has also good knowledge of Cassandra, Kafka and can communicate with technical and non-technical people. The candidate is passionate about high code quality and will be almost exclusively involved with backend and infrastructural tasks. The candidate is known to evangelize best practices and knows how to properly introduce new technologies to an existing architecture. Furthermore, the candidate takes CI/CD pipelines and performance testing seriously and makes sure that the piece of code is covered with unit and integration tests such as Selenium and Protractor testing.

Expected

6+ years of experience working in a professional product-driven environment
Experience with the Java, Spring Ecosystem
Experience with Big Data stack (ex. Cassandra, Kafka)
Experience with Version control systems (Git)
Experience with Unix / Linux
Experience with the full deployment cycle

Preferred

Experience with the Atlassian stack (Jira, Confluence)
Experience with AWS Cloud
Experience with Scrum/Kanban

What’s in it for you:

Competitive salary and great benefits. Working with a highly motivated team and last but not least, the opportunity to work in an informal environment with ample opportunities for professional development on projects that impact millions of consumers worldwide.

Pioneering entrepreneurial atmosphere
Training, conferences and personal development opportunities
Working for one of the fastest growing CDP +Journey Orchestration platforms in Europe
A fun, dynamic workplace with everything from ping pong and foosball to a comfy relaxation room

Communal lunch & Healthy and less healthy snacks all day long
Weekly bootcamp on location
Flexible working hours and workspace
A fun and connected community with monthly and quarterly meetings/events & Innovation week
Pension scheme

Job Title: React Front-end engineer (CMS / AEM experience is a plus)
Job Description:
ERIKS Digital is looking for a Front-end engineer (preferably with CMS/AEM experience)
We are working on 5 different propositions, building new digital solutions for our external customers and

internal use. As our Front-end engineer you will join the AEM team and be mainly responsible for developing

and improving the customer facing part of our websites (of 20 different countries!).
We are looking for a developer to lead the front-end development of all these local websites, based on AEM.
This an interesting opportunity for someone that likes to build things, operate internationally and work with great people! It will
involve making architectural choices and design decisions together with leads of various disciplines like our FE

architect. You will work closely together in a scrum team with the Product Owner, back-end developer,

designers, test automation engineer, DevOps and the marketing team.
Furthermore, you will be working with the other Front-end colleagues of ERIKS digital. The Front-end discipline

collaborates to contribute to a seamless customer journey cross product, tackle architectural challenges, and

share knowledge and important learnings between the different product teams. We have organized various

sessions cross-teams to facilitate this and to work on a Front-end road map together.

Job duties and responsibilities

§ Translate user stories into production grade React application

§ Define and make architectural choices together with our FE architect that will lead to a smart product

§ Build reusable components and Front-end libraries for future use

§ Work with the UX team to incorporate customer feedback and create an easy to use and loveable product

§ Work on bugs and customer feedback in a way that makes our customers happy

§ Integrate our corporate websites with our other digital solutions (like eCommerce)

§ You will assess feature and implementation requests and build these within new or existing AEM ecosystems
We are looking for someone with:

§ Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript

§ Knowledge of CSS preprocessors (SASS) and CSS-in-JS (styled components)

§ Strong proficiency in JavaScript (TypeScript is a plus)

§ Knowledge of Responsive Design, attention to details, and development best practices

§ Experience with build tools (webpack, gulp)

§ Experience in working with React and good understanding of its core principles

§ Experience with CMS / AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) is a huge plus

§ Familiarity with RESTful APIs

§ Experience working with unit testing (Jest)

§ Knowledge of version control systems like Git

§ Demonstrable ability to make no-nonsense architectures and software and work on integrations with the backend
Personal competence:

§ Enjoys working within a scrum team and will not hesitate to ask colleagues for advice and help in solving your

challenges

§ Pragmatic, analytical, results focused

§ Ability to make complex matters simple

§ Comfortable with being the only Front-end engineer in the team

§ Pro-active and likes to work on activities next to the development tasks

§ Desire to work in a diverse and enjoyable team and to contribute to our productivity and fun at work!
What do we offer?

Competitive salary and a good pension scheme
Small & high energy team, lots of challenges
Working on new technologies and have impact on decision making
Limited defined roles and paths
Joining interesting conferences
Fast learning experience due to immediate scale-up potential
A nice office next to Amstel station with a good lunch
Flexibility

Eriks Digital is an equal opportunity employer and strives for equal treatment for all genders. Eriks Digital adheres to ethical recruiting methods ensuring that we do not discriminate against any candidate because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation. This is a fundamental part of our values and beliefs and we strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can reach their potential.

This an interesting opportunity for someone that likes to build things, operate internationally and work with great people! It will
involve making architectural choices and design decisions together with leads of various disciplines like our FE

architect. You will work closely together in a scrum team with the Product Owner, back-end developer,

designers, test automation engineer, DevOps and the marketing team.
Furthermore, you will be working with the other Front-end colleagues of ERIKS digital. The Front-end discipline

collaborates to contribute to a seamless customer journey cross product, tackle architectural challenges, and

share knowledge and important learnings between the different product teams. We have organized various

sessions cross-teams to facilitate this and to work on a Front-end road map together.

Job duties and responsibilities

§ Translate user stories into production grade React application

§ Define and make architectural choices together with our FE architect that will lead to a smart product

§ Build reusable components and Front-end libraries for future use

§ Work with the UX team to incorporate customer feedback and create an easy to use and loveable product

§ Work on bugs and customer feedback in a way that makes our customers happy

§ Integrate our corporate websites with our other digital solutions (like eCommerce)

§ You will assess feature and implementation requests and build these within new or existing AEM ecosystems
We are looking for someone with:

§ Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript

§ Knowledge of CSS preprocessors (SASS) and CSS-in-JS (styled components)

§ Knowledge of Responsive Design, attention to details, and development best practices

§ Experience with build tools (webpack, gulp)

§ Experience in working with React and good understanding of its core principles

§ Experience with CMS / AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) is a huge plus

§ Familiarity with RESTful APIs

§ Experience working with unit testing (Jest)

§ Knowledge of version control systems like Git

§ Demonstrable ability to make no-nonsense architectures and software and work on integrations with the backend
Personal competence:

§ Enjoys working within a scrum team and will not hesitate to ask colleagues for advice and help in solving your

challenges

§ Pragmatic, analytical, results focused

§ Ability to make complex matters simple

§ Comfortable with being the only Front-end engineer in the team

§ Pro-active and likes to work on activities next to the development tasks

§ Desire to work in a diverse and enjoyable team and to contribute to our productivity and fun at work!

Competitive salary and a good pension scheme
Small & high energy team, lots of challenges
Working on new technologies and have impact on decision making

Challenge
Come join a team that has the audacious goal to build a communication system that changes the world!

Hiber (hiber.global) is a young and fast growing company in the Internet of Things sector!

Did you know that 90% of the globe has no affordable connectivity? So how can we ensure the fishing industry to be sustainable, improve the water usage whilst improving crop yields, and reduce the carbon footprints within the transportation sector? The answer is Hiber: by using a constellation of nano satellites we enable connectivity for remote and rural areas. With this connectivity, the opportunities for all types of businesses are boundless.
We enable global climate monitoring, precision farming, marine life protection and many other ways to improve life on earth!

Thanks to a continuous expansion (with more products to be launched in 2021) we are now in need of a Product Owner for our Via team. This is a Product Owner role with a very hardware/embedded software development flavour.

Hiberband Via is an on+off grid M2M (machine to machine) gateway that offers device duplex IoT-satellite connectivity. We are about to release the second version of this product, you will take it from there.
Hiberband Via connects to sensors to form a solution (see HiberHilo and HiberHeavy). These solutions are managed by Product Managers who discover new markets and understand customers/users’ needs, problems, and desires.


You work together with the Product Managers to into your team prioritise efforts, you shield them from the unnecessary noise, and (very important) you keep them sane.

Your responsibility is to work together with product managers to define the new product versions that will be solving the customers’ most compelling problems.

What’s in it for you

Working with a motivated team of professional Product Owners, Project Managers, Developers, Engineers etc
Inspirational innovative start-up environment,
Being a part of a groundbreaking innovations with 21st century tech pioneers,
A state of the art, satellite IoT telecommunication system,
A team of many disciplines and even more big brains to work with,
Flexible hours, work-from-home options, office lunch, sauna, gym, chill floor (pool table, bar, dj set) and so much more!
Responsibilities:

Represent the customer within the company
Ensure user stories are detailed and well written
Groom the product backlog and ensure is always clear and visible
Own the product lifecycle management (PLM) throughout all its phases (from ideation of new product features to market launch and results evaluation)
Be the driving force of the Ideation and feasibility phase
Conduct problem discovery sessions by engaging with customers, users, and colleagues to identify the core problem worth solvingIdeate and validate new product releases
Build and maintain the product roadmap
Build a framework to measure the success of your product; gather feedback on how to improve its upcoming product releases

You love tech and...

Have a relevant degree with at least 3 years of experience working in a similar role in Tech
Are a Product Owner who has already developed a physical product (hardware or embedded software)
Have an engineering background, and you know some psychology basis
Love writing, and you know why it is so important
Commit to find a problem worth solving and to build the best solution
Have the desire to solve a problem, and you know how to keep your ego out of the room
Aim at outcome, not at output (and you actually know the difference between the two)
Love to run workshops and present to people
Feel amazing working in a new uncertain terrain
Seldom assume, instead you always check and gather more information

Have the desire to solve a problem, and you know how to keep your ego out of the room
Aim at outcome, not at output (and you actually know the difference between the two)
Love to run workshops and present to people
Feel amazing working in a new uncertain terrain
Seldom assume, instead you always check and gather more information

Challenge
Come join a team that has the audacious goal to build a communication system that changes the world!

Hiber (hiber.global) is a young and fast growing company in the Internet of Things sector!

Did you know that 90% of the globe has no affordable connectivity? So how can we ensure the fishing industry to be sustainable, improve the water usage whilst improving crop yields, and reduce the carbon footprints within the transportation sector? The answer is Hiber: by using a constellation of nano satellites we enable connectivity for remote and rural areas. With this connectivity, the opportunities for all types of businesses are boundless.
We enable global climate monitoring, precision farming, marine life protection and many other ways to improve life on earth!

Thanks to a continuous expansion (with more products to be launched in 2021) we are now in need of a Product Owner for our Via team. This is a Product Owner role with a very hardware/embedded software development flavour.

Hiberband Via is an on+off grid M2M (machine to machine) gateway that offers device duplex IoT-satellite connectivity. We are about to release the second version of this product, you will take it from there.
Hiberband Via connects to sensors to form a solution (see HiberHilo and HiberHeavy). These solutions are managed by Product Managers who discover new markets and understand customers/users’ needs, problems, and desires.


You work together with the Product Managers to into your team prioritise efforts, you shield them from the unnecessary noise, and (very important) you keep them sane.

Your responsibility is to work together with product managers to define the new product versions that will be solving the customers’ most compelling problems.

What’s in it for you

Working with a motivated team of professional Product Owners, Project Managers, Developers, Engineers etc
Inspirational innovative start-up environment,
Being a part of a groundbreaking innovations with 21st century tech pioneers,
A state of the art, satellite IoT telecommunication system,
A team of many disciplines and even more big brains to work with,
Flexible hours, work-from-home options, office lunch, sauna, gym, chill floor (pool table, bar, dj set) and so much more!
Responsibilities:

Represent the customer within the company
Ensure user stories are detailed and well written
Groom the product backlog and ensure is always clear and visible
Own the product lifecycle management (PLM) throughout all its phases (from ideation of new product features to market launch and results evaluation)
Be the driving force of the Ideation and feasibility phase
Conduct problem discovery sessions by engaging with customers, users, and colleagues to identify the core problem worth solvingIdeate and validate new product releases
Build and maintain the product roadmap
Build a framework to measure the success of your product; gather feedback on how to improve its upcoming product releases

You love tech and...

Have a relevant degree with at least 3 years of experience working in a similar role in Tech
Are a Product Owner who has already developed a physical product (hardware or embedded software)
Have an engineering background, and you know some psychology basis

Employment typePermanent
LocationHoofddorp, the Netherlands
Seniority levelExperienced
Education levelBachelor degree
OMRON Healthcare is a global leader in the field of clinically proven, innovative medical equipment for health monitoring (Blood Pressure Monitors) and therapy (Nebulizers & Pain Management). We praise ourselves for making zero compromises when it comes to the healthier lives of our consumers, this attitude has delivered us the global leader in the sector of Blood Pressure monitors.
OMRON Healthcare Europe is searching for a Business Analyst to join our Information and Communications Technology team. Headquartered in Hoofddorp – the Amsterdam metropolitan area – the Netherlands, we offer a challenging and rewarding opportunity in a diverse environment, with excellent opportunities to expand your skills and experience on an international level.
Reporting to the Head of Information and Communications Technology, you will play a critical role in the co-development and execution of the analytical strategy keeping continuous change in mind by supporting the business in improving processes, products, and services through data analysis by designing/developing and implementing reports, dashboards, and interactive visualizations through Analytical software solutions. (S)he acts as the bridge between business problems and technology solutions.
Your Key Responsibilities:
Reach out to functional business areas to ensure that their Analytical information needs are met by gathering, analyze, and translate data and business requirements; define user/business requirements, develop functional specifications, develop technical specifications, execute unit/string/system test, and develop documentation and train the business.
Enhancing the value chain and operational efficiency through Alteryx and Tableau solutions.
Manage deliverables and timelines within the project management structure for internal and external stakeholders.
 Ensures optimal functioning and keeping compliance on data, data integration, and data warehouses.
Partner with the business to identify opportunities for logical and procedural improvement related to and beyond the Analytics scope. This includes process improvement, system selection, and strategic development.

Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree in Information Technology.
4-7 years’ experience with Tableau and ideally experience with Alteryx.
Recognized as an expert in disclosing information from systems smartly.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in the English language, both written and verbal.
Strong stakeholder management skills.
Able to steer external suppliers.
A team player and drive continuous change.

OMRON Healthcare is a global leader in the field of clinically proven, innovative medical equipment for health monitoring (Blood Pressure Monitors) and therapy (Nebulizers & Pain Management). We praise ourselves for making zero compromises when it comes to the healthier lives of our consumers, this attitude has delivered us the global leader in the sector of Blood Pressure monitors.
OMRON Healthcare Europe is searching for a Business Analyst to join our Information and Communications Technology team. Headquartered in Hoofddorp – the Amsterdam metropolitan area – the Netherlands, we offer a challenging and rewarding opportunity in a diverse environment, with excellent opportunities to expand your skills and experience on an international level.
Reporting to the Head of Information and Communications Technology, you will play a critical role in the co-development and execution of the analytical strategy keeping continuous change in mind by supporting the business in improving processes, products, and services through data analysis by designing/developing and implementing reports, dashboards, and interactive visualizations through Analytical software solutions. (S)he acts as the bridge between business problems and technology solutions.
Your Key Responsibilities:
Reach out to functional business areas to ensure that their Analytical information needs are met by gathering, analyze, and translate data and business requirements; define user/business requirements, develop functional specifications, develop technical specifications, execute unit/string/system test, and develop documentation and train the business.
Enhancing the value chain and operational efficiency through Alteryx and Tableau solutions.
Manage deliverables and timelines within the project management structure for internal and external stakeholders.
 Ensures optimal functioning and keeping compliance on data, data integration, and data warehouses.
Partner with the business to identify opportunities for logical and procedural improvement related to and beyond the Analytics scope. This includes process improvement, system selection, and strategic development.

Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree in Information Technology.
4-7 years’ experience with Tableau and ideally experience with Alteryx.
Recognized as an expert in disclosing information from systems smartly.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in the English language, both written and verbal.
Strong stakeholder management skills.
Able to steer external suppliers.
A team player and drive continuous change.

Will you give us the best advice about Cloud applications?

As Cloud Developer at Luminis Amsterdam you advise about and implement solutions for our customers to modernise their application landscape. You do this according to cloud architecture principles.
Dit zijn jouw collega's
What does the job entail?
You will work hands-on with our customers to realise new solutions for their applications
You analyse the current landscape and formulate advice based on your specialization
Within Luminis you are a part of our Cloud Solution portfolio

Give your input about the development and optimisation of our cloud solutions
Share knowledge and expertise about new technologies with your colleagues and our clients through Meetups, white papers and blogs
If you are willing, we offer you a chance to take the stage and contribute to our own IT conference: DevCon
Requirements
2 – 5 years of work experience in Software Development or Operations
Basic engineering skills (Git, bash or Powershell)
Experience with at least one programming language and / or with scripting (Java, JavaScript, Python, .NET, Spring Boot)
You enjoy working with Agile / Scrum and have experience with a DevOps way of working
You have knowledge of Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)
You have experience with CI / CD (Jenkins, Concourse, CircleCI or Gitlab CI / CD), Containers and Orchestrators (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, Rancher or Nomad) and Infrastructure as code and configuration management (Terraform, Cloudformation, Ansible or Puppet)
What do we offer?
An excellent salary
29 days of paid leave
A mobile phone
Travel allowance or lease car
The space to discover and voice your initiatives and ideas
A motivated team of professional colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge and experience with you
Freedom, responsibility and space to grow

Sitecore Developer CarNext.com

Expert in the field of interaction design and online marketing

Driven and curious enough to get the maximum out of Sitecore? Want to look for the best solutions to meet the customer's needs? Our rapidly developing platform needs you. Apply now and make an impact at CarNext.com.

Bring the solution

We are disrupting the European market for high-quality used cars. In doing so we need to keep our CMS up-to-date and running smooth. Do you want to become a part of this challenge?

As our Sitecore Developer you get to develop and manage all our Sitecore environments. You coordinate with other teams and stakeholders to implement new solutions in Sitecore. And you are responsible for the deployment of these new features. You also advise our stakeholders about possibilities and solutions of Sitecore. Making our CMS future-proof and easy to use.

You will become part of our IT team, located at our headquarters in Amsterdam, and report to the IT Manager.

Do you have what it takes to work with us towards a next level platform? Apply now for the role of Sitecore Developer at CarNext.com.

Responsibilities of the job

A summary of your most important activities:

Developing and managing Sitecore environments.
Creating new features and endpoints for Sitecore, including Sitecore JSS.
Coordinating the implementation of new solutions in Sitecore with other stakeholders.
Advising stakeholders about suitable new solutions and possibilities.
Recommending best practices for the content structure in a multi-site solution.
Releasing new features in the Sitecore environments.
Maintaining existing solutions.

Required skills

For this role you need to have the following qualifications and competences:

Excellent English communication skills (verbal and writing).
A bachelor's degree in a related field, like software development or computer sciences.
At least 3 years of work experience with Sitecore.
Extensive and always up to date knowledge about Sitecore 9 (XM) and JSS.
Knowledge about ASP.NET, AWS, TeamCity and Octopus.
Experience with Unicorn and Synthesis for code and template generation.
Know-how about making and using a Sitecore Cloud architecture.
Ability to use PowerShell scripts for Sitecore.
Clear and conceivable communication style towards all stakeholders.
Very capable of setting the priorities and making realistic schedules for deployments.
Thrive in a very dynamic and versatile work environment.

Grow with us

Sitecore Developer CarNext.com

Expert in the field of interaction design and online marketing

Driven and curious enough to get the maximum out of Sitecore? Want to look for the best solutions to meet the customer's needs? Our rapidly developing platform needs you. Apply now and make an impact at CarNext.com.

Bring the solution

We are disrupting the European market for high-quality used cars. In doing so we need to keep our CMS up-to-date and running smooth. Do you want to become a part of this challenge?

As our Sitecore Developer you get to develop and manage all our Sitecore environments. You coordinate with other teams and stakeholders to implement new solutions in Sitecore. And you are responsible for the deployment of these new features. You also advise our stakeholders about possibilities and solutions of Sitecore. Making our CMS future-proof and easy to use.

You will become part of our IT team, located at our headquarters in Amsterdam, and report to the IT Manager.

Do you have what it takes to work with us towards a next level platform? Apply now for the role of Sitecore Developer at CarNext.com.

Responsibilities of the job

A summary of your most important activities:

Developing and managing Sitecore environments.
Creating new features and endpoints for Sitecore, including Sitecore JSS.
Coordinating the implementation of new solutions in Sitecore with other stakeholders.
Advising stakeholders about suitable new solutions and possibilities.
Recommending best practices for the content structure in a multi-site solution.
Releasing new features in the Sitecore environments.
Maintaining existing solutions.

Required skills

For this role you need to have the following qualifications and competences:

Excellent English communication skills (verbal and writing).
A bachelor's degree in a related field, like software development or computer sciences.
At least 3 years of work experience with Sitecore.
Extensive and always up to date knowledge about Sitecore 9 (XM) and JSS.
Knowledge about ASP.NET, AWS, TeamCity and Octopus.
Experience with Unicorn and Synthesis for code and template generation.
Know-how about making and using a Sitecore Cloud architecture.
Ability to use PowerShell scripts for Sitecore.
Clear and conceivable communication style towards all stakeholders.
Very capable of setting the priorities and making realistic schedules for deployments.
Thrive in a very dynamic and versatile work environment.

Job Title: Industry X Analyst - Intelligent Products & Platforms
Job Description:
In Industry X we shape the future of making things, and the things we make.
Our Industry X Team drives innovation by delivering the best-in-class management consultancy based on industrial experience leveraged by the latest technologies. The future of making things, and the things we make. Evolution of industry practices have been witnessed with evolution of technology. We've been helping businesses adopt and implement the new for years; it is critical we apply this to manufacturers and products companies, service organizations and software companies, to fuel their next level of growth.
Intelligent Products and Platforms directly links engineering and product development spend to business value, unlocking innovative new sources of growth for our clients. Our expertise puts us at the core of our clients’ product and service value chains; fusing hardware, software, connectivity and cloud to deliver winning experiences while ensuring business results. Our way of working is to collaborate across the industries and the services to reinvent clients’ products, services and platforms, to be smarter and more connected. Join us as we reinvent industries across Consumer Goods & Services and Retail Products, Industrial Equipment & Construction, Medical Tech Equipment, Media, High Tech, Aerospace and Defense, Chemicals, Oil and Gas, and Utilities
Your Job

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Industry X group in the Netherlands with focus on Intelligent Products and Platforms (IPP). We partner with our clients to build platform-based business and operating models, helping to navigate the shift to experience-driven innovation and accelerate time to revenue. We architect, design, develop, and build software, hardware and scalable products in this space. We help our clients transform their organizations to innovate and launch new businesses to optimize the return on investment of our clients’ legacy and new product spend to ensure long-term sustainability of their businesses.
What are your responsibilities?
Support in Engineering and R&D transformation programs to drive process & innovation activities at our clientsBe passionate to work on Industry X related technologies and supporting client digital transformation journeysDeliver & support business process innovation workshops and inspire others by developing and showcasing various Industry X technologies, capabilities and offeringsCollaborate with other key capabilities where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Innovation practicesHave excellent verbal and written communication skillsYou’re as good with people as you are with business processes and technology, a true team player with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Your team

Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background

University degree with a strong affinity for technology1-2 years of relevant industry experiencePassionate about digital transformations, Digital Thread & Digital Twin strategies, connected products and extended reality solutions (AR/VR)Fluent in English, both spoken and writtenWillingness to travel to (international) client sites (in compliance with up-to-date travel policies)
Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)An expense allowanceDiscount on Accenture sharesThe possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week
Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.
Questions? Connect with Josephine Sillevis Smitt, j.sillevis.smitt@accenture.com

Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. In Industry X we shape the future of making things, and the things we make.
Our Industry X Team drives innovation by delivering the best-in-class management consultancy based on industrial experience leveraged by the latest technologies. The future of making things, and the things we make. Evolution of industry practices have been witnessed with evolution of technology. We've been helping businesses adopt and implement the new for years; it is critical we apply this to manufacturers and products companies, service organizations and software companies, to fuel their next level of growth.
Intelligent Products and Platforms directly links engineering and product development spend to business value, unlocking innovative new sources of growth for our clients. Our expertise puts us at the core of our clients’ product and service value chains; fusing hardware, software, connectivity and cloud to deliver winning experiences while ensuring business results. Our way of working is to collaborate across the industries and the services to reinvent clients’ products, services and platforms, to be smarter and more connected. Join us as we reinvent industries across Consumer Goods & Services and Retail Products, Industrial Equipment & Construction, Medical Tech Equipment, Media, High Tech, Aerospace and Defense, Chemicals, Oil and Gas, and Utilities
Your Job

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Industry X group in the Netherlands with focus on Intelligent Products and Platforms (IPP). We partner with our clients to build platform-based business and operating models, helping to navigate the shift to experience-driven innovation and accelerate time to revenue. We architect, design, develop, and build software, hardware and scalable products in this space. We help our clients transform their organizations to innovate and launch new businesses to optimize the return on investment of our clients’ legacy and new product spend to ensure long-term sustainability of their businesses.
What are your responsibilities?
Support in Engineering and R&D transformation programs to drive process & innovation activities at our clientsBe passionate to work on Industry X related technologies and supporting client digital transformation journeysDeliver & support business process innovation workshops and inspire others by developing and showcasing various Industry X technologies, capabilities and offeringsCollaborate with other key capabilities where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Innovation practicesHave excellent verbal and written communication skillsYou’re as good with people as you are with business processes and technology, a true team player with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Your team

Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background

University degree with a strong affinity for technology1-2 years of relevant industry experiencePassionate about digital transformations, Digital Thread & Digital Twin strategies, connected products and extended reality solutions (AR/VR)Fluent in English, both spoken and writtenWillingness to travel to (international) client sites (in compliance with up-to-date travel policies)
Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)An expense allowanceDiscount on Accenture sharesThe possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week
Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.
Questions? Connect with Josephine Sillevis Smitt, j.sillevis.smitt@accenture.com

Your background

Job Title: Industry X Analyst - Intelligent Products & Platforms
Job Description:
In Industry X we shape the future of making things, and the things we make.
Our Industry X Team drives innovation by delivering the best-in-class management consultancy based on industrial experience leveraged by the latest technologies. The future of making things, and the things we make. Evolution of industry practices have been witnessed with evolution of technology. We've been helping businesses adopt and implement the new for years; it is critical we apply this to manufacturers and products companies, service organizations and software companies, to fuel their next level of growth.
Intelligent Products and Platforms directly links engineering and product development spend to business value, unlocking innovative new sources of growth for our clients. Our expertise puts us at the core of our clients’ product and service value chains; fusing hardware, software, connectivity and cloud to deliver winning experiences while ensuring business results. Our way of working is to collaborate across the industries and the services to reinvent clients’ products, services and platforms, to be smarter and more connected. Join us as we reinvent industries across Consumer Goods & Services and Retail Products, Industrial Equipment & Construction, Medical Tech Equipment, Media, High Tech, Aerospace and Defense, Chemicals, Oil and Gas, and Utilities
Your Job

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Industry X group in the Netherlands with focus on Intelligent Products and Platforms (IPP). We partner with our clients to build platform-based business and operating models, helping to navigate the shift to experience-driven innovation and accelerate time to revenue. We architect, design, develop, and build software, hardware and scalable products in this space. We help our clients transform their organizations to innovate and launch new businesses to optimize the return on investment of our clients’ legacy and new product spend to ensure long-term sustainability of their businesses.
What are your responsibilities?
Support in Engineering and R&D transformation programs to drive process & innovation activities at our clientsBe passionate to work on Industry X related technologies and supporting client digital transformation journeysDeliver & support business process innovation workshops and inspire others by developing and showcasing various Industry X technologies, capabilities and offeringsCollaborate with other key capabilities where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Innovation practicesHave excellent verbal and written communication skillsYou’re as good with people as you are with business processes and technology, a true team player with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Your team

Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background

University degree with a strong affinity for technology1-2 years of relevant industry experiencePassionate about digital transformations, Digital Thread & Digital Twin strategies, connected products and extended reality solutions (AR/VR)Fluent in English, both spoken and writtenWillingness to travel to (international) client sites (in compliance with up-to-date travel policies)
Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)An expense allowanceDiscount on Accenture sharesThe possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week
Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.
Questions? Connect with Josephine Sillevis Smitt, j.sillevis.smitt@accenture.com

Functieomschrijving
Within the team, their digital channels are continuously adapted to optimize the customer experience and to add business value. As a software engineer, you are responsible for the continuous development, construction, and implementation of business wishes as well as our own. Their solutions are enabled across multiple digital channels such as the Voice Response System, KPN App, Online channels, and others. They make this possible via microservices API’s and primarily using web components to enable the touchpoints towards our customers, as a team, they aim to be end to end responsible as much as possible and in touch with our customers.
You are a code wizard who knows how to ask the right questions to excel in your work. Based on your education and expertise, you are able to translate business requirements into functional solutions and build the solutions to allow their customers to be self-sufficient around the clock. You understand what it takes to deliver omnichannel added value within this position. You have experience in working in a DevOps scrum team and project context via the agile/ scrum way of working. Apart from that you have good analytical ability, are a real team player and you are able to work with other teams (also remotely), so you need to have good English communication skills.
Functie-eisen
Requirements:Working experience in a relevant jobPython , Python Django frameworkUnderstanding of DevOps fundamentalsUnderstanding of Cloud technology, Docker, Kubernetes or similar tools, cloud environments with preference in AWS, application monitoring.Understanding of CI/CD and automation via Jenkins.Understanding of microservices architecture and building/consuming API’sKnowledge and experience with unit testing (currently they use pytest and golem)Knowledge and experience with version control via GITSome understanding of Front End basicsSelf-managing, team player, curious to learn, flexible, not afraid to ask questions
Taalvaardigheid
Vereist: Engels

Overige info
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Extra Info:Duration: 6 months with an option to extendWorking from home until government measures regarding Corona allows to work in the office again.Location Amsterdam

They make this possible via microservices API’s and primarily using web components to enable the touchpoints towards our customers, as a team, they aim to be end to end responsible as much as possible and in touch with our customers.
You are a code wizard who knows how to ask the right questions to excel in your work. Based on your education and expertise, you are able to translate business requirements into functional solutions and build the solutions to allow their customers to be self-sufficient around the clock. You understand what it takes to deliver omnichannel added value within this position. You have experience in working in a DevOps scrum team and project context via the agile/ scrum way of working. Apart from that you have good analytical ability, are a real team player and you are able to work with other teams (also remotely), so you need to have good English communication skills.
Functie-eisen
Requirements:Working experience in a relevant jobPython , Python Django frameworkUnderstanding of DevOps fundamentalsUnderstanding of Cloud technology, Docker, Kubernetes or similar tools, cloud environments with preference in AWS, application monitoring.Understanding of CI/CD and automation via Jenkins.Understanding of microservices architecture and building/consuming API’sKnowledge and experience with unit testing (currently they use pytest and golem)Knowledge and experience with version control via GITSome understanding of Front End basicsSelf-managing, team player, curious to learn, flexible, not afraid to ask questions
Taalvaardigheid
Vereist: Engels

Overige info
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Extra Info:Duration: 6 months with an option to extendWorking from home until government measures regarding Corona allows to work in the office again.Location Amsterdam

Every company has a mission. At Accruent, ours is to fundamentally change the way organizations run their built environment. By delivering data-led intelligence, Accruent can transform the way people and systems work together and help them drive business forward. We’re mission ready.
Are you? Because our International Channel Sales team is looking for a:
Partner Manager - Location: the Netherlands or Germany
What are your responsibilities:
As Partner Manager, your responsibilities will be designing and executing our Partner Program, together with our partners, while developing strong relationships, growing our market footprint and driving revenue and growth. You will facilitate alignment between partner organizations and our internal sales and marketing team to develop objectives, strategies and manage them throughout the partner lifecycle. You will always have a focus on further developing our partners, so that we can grow our footprint, whilst identifying new opportunities in both existing and new partner accounts.
But what type of daily activities should you think of?
Based on the agreed Partner Program, you’ll support the partner in developing joint activities;
You will join/guide our partners in customer/prospects meetings for presentations and negotiations where you will represent Accruent and the partner. Your sales experience will help you drive opportunities to a win. When needed you will onboard new partners and will conduct sales training. Other than that, you will proactively assess, clarify, and validate our partner's needs, and ensure that our partners are compliant with our agreements. All of the above, while tracking performance objectives, forecasts, and reports.
In this role, you will be mainly responsible for positioning Accruent’s Meridian and Maintenance Connection solution and will be responsible for the Benelux/DACH, UK, and Pacific region. As Partner Manager, you will report directly to the Director of Channel Sales.
What we offer:
We offer you a great opportunity in which you will work together as one team, with people all over the world and get the chance to contribute to the success of our customers and Partners. It will be your time to develop and grow in an innovative, dynamic, and fast-moving environment, where you'll receive a competitive remuneration package, but most importantly the opportunity to build your own success. We at Accruent, create an environment where there is room for ideas and initiatives, experiences are impactful, and talent is developed. Currently, all our employees are working from home, due to the COVID-19 situation. Once we are allowed to, you will be working in our fully refurnished modern new office in Hoofddorp and you are expected to travel 25% of your time to our international Partners and their customers.
What you bring to the table:
You are driven by success and have a commercial and sales driven mindset!
We are looking for someone with at least 3 years of experience within SaaS both in direct and Channel/Partner Sales, who understands/has experience in the heavy asset/manufacturing industry. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and can engage effectively with all levels both internally and externally. Your previous experience in negotiations and customer-facing presentations will help you to be successful. Being fluent in English and additionally Dutch or German is required. A Bachelor degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or related would be a plus.
If you got excited about the opportunity, then you can directly apply via the apply button!
We will be happy to help and share even more details with you.
We hope to hear from you soon!
Due to the international character of our hiring team, we kindly ask you to apply in English.
All employment offers are made contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. A background check may include: verification of education and past employment, criminal background reports, motor vehicle driving records, or reference checks. The company is the sole determinant of a successful background check. Assessment may be part of the application process.
ABOUT ACCRUENT
Accruent is a global software company that helps organizations achieve superior performance by transforming how they manage their physical resources. Its innovative, industry-leading cloud-based software and services enable organizations to optimize all stages of real estate, facilities and asset management, from capital planning through to IoT-based monitoring and control. With a proven track record across two decades, Accruent has created the only integrated SaaS-based framework and reporting platform for full lifecycle physical resource management. More than 10,000 global customers depend on Accruent solutions to drive out hidden costs, extend asset lifecycles, protect their brands, ensure compliance and deliver on the missions of their organization. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Accruent serves a wide range of industries in 149 countries around the world. For more information, visit www.accruent.com.

It will be your time to develop and grow in an innovative, dynamic, and fast-moving environment, where you'll receive a competitive remuneration package, but most importantly the opportunity to build your own success. We at Accruent, create an environment where there is room for ideas and initiatives, experiences are impactful, and talent is developed. Currently, all our employees are working from home, due to the COVID-19 situation. Once we are allowed to, you will be working in our fully refurnished modern new office in Hoofddorp and you are expected to travel 25% of your time to our international Partners and their customers.
What you bring to the table:
You are driven by success and have a commercial and sales driven mindset!
We are looking for someone with at least 3 years of experience within SaaS both in direct and Channel/Partner Sales, who understands/has experience in the heavy asset/manufacturing industry. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and can engage effectively with all levels both internally and externally. Your previous experience in negotiations and customer-facing presentations will help you to be successful. Being fluent in English and additionally Dutch or German is required. A Bachelor degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or related would be a plus.
If you got excited about the opportunity, then you can directly apply via the apply button!
We will be happy to help and share even more details with you.
We hope to hear from you soon!
Due to the international character of our hiring team, we kindly ask you to apply in English.
All employment offers are made contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. A background check may include: verification of education and past employment, criminal background reports, motor vehicle driving records, or reference checks. The company is the sole determinant of a successful background check. Assessment may be part of the application process.
ABOUT ACCRUENT
Accruent is a global software company that helps organizations achieve superior performance by transforming how they manage their physical resources. Its innovative, industry-leading cloud-based software and services enable organizations to optimize all stages of real estate, facilities and asset management, from capital planning through to IoT-based monitoring and control. With a proven track record across two decades, Accruent has created the only integrated SaaS-based framework and reporting platform for full lifecycle physical resource management. More than 10,000 global customers depend on Accruent solutions to drive out hidden costs, extend asset lifecycles, protect their brands, ensure compliance and deliver on the missions of their organization. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Accruent serves a wide range of industries in 149 countries around the world. For more information, visit www.accruent.com.

Every company has a mission. At Accruent, ours is to fundamentally change the way organizations run their built environment. By delivering data-led intelligence, Accruent can transform the way people and systems work together and help them drive business forward. We’re mission ready.
Are you? Because our International Channel Sales team is looking for a:
Partner Manager - Location: the Netherlands or Germany
What are your responsibilities:
As Partner Manager, your responsibilities will be designing and executing our Partner Program, together with our partners, while developing strong relationships, growing our market footprint and driving revenue and growth. You will facilitate alignment between partner organizations and our internal sales and marketing team to develop objectives, strategies and manage them throughout the partner lifecycle. You will always have a focus on further developing our partners, so that we can grow our footprint, whilst identifying new opportunities in both existing and new partner accounts.
But what type of daily activities should you think of?
Based on the agreed Partner Program, you’ll support the partner in developing joint activities;
You will join/guide our partners in customer/prospects meetings for presentations and negotiations where you will represent Accruent and the partner. Your sales experience will help you drive opportunities to a win. When needed you will onboard new partners and will conduct sales training. Other than that, you will proactively assess, clarify, and validate our partner's needs, and ensure that our partners are compliant with our agreements. All of the above, while tracking performance objectives, forecasts, and reports.
In this role, you will be mainly responsible for positioning Accruent’s Meridian and Maintenance Connection solution and will be responsible for the Benelux/DACH, UK, and Pacific region. As Partner Manager, you will report directly to the Director of Channel Sales.
What we offer:
We offer you a great opportunity in which you will work together as one team, with people all over the world and get the chance to contribute to the success of our customers and Partners. It will be your time to develop and grow in an innovative, dynamic, and fast-moving environment, where you'll receive a competitive remuneration package, but most importantly the opportunity to build your own success. We at Accruent, create an environment where there is room for ideas and initiatives, experiences are impactful, and talent is developed. Currently, all our employees are working from home, due to the COVID-19 situation. Once we are allowed to, you will be working in our fully refurnished modern new office in Hoofddorp and you are expected to travel 25% of your time to our international Partners and their customers.
What you bring to the table:
You are driven by success and have a commercial and sales driven mindset!
We are looking for someone with at least 3 years of experience within SaaS both in direct and Channel/Partner Sales, who understands/has experience in the heavy asset/manufacturing industry. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and can engage effectively with all levels both internally and externally. Your previous experience in negotiations and customer-facing presentations will help you to be successful. Being fluent in English and additionally Dutch or German is required. A Bachelor degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or related would be a plus.
If you got excited about the opportunity, then you can directly apply via the apply button!
We will be happy to help and share even more details with you.
We hope to hear from you soon!
Due to the international character of our hiring team, we kindly ask you to apply in English.

All of the above, while tracking performance objectives, forecasts, and reports.
In this role, you will be mainly responsible for positioning Accruent’s Meridian and Maintenance Connection solution and will be responsible for the Benelux/DACH, UK, and Pacific region. As Partner Manager, you will report directly to the Director of Channel Sales.
What we offer:
We offer you a great opportunity in which you will work together as one team, with people all over the world and get the chance to contribute to the success of our customers and Partners. It will be your time to develop and grow in an innovative, dynamic, and fast-moving environment, where you'll receive a competitive remuneration package, but most importantly the opportunity to build your own success. We at Accruent, create an environment where there is room for ideas and initiatives, experiences are impactful, and talent is developed. Currently, all our employees are working from home, due to the COVID-19 situation. Once we are allowed to, you will be working in our fully refurnished modern new office in Hoofddorp and you are expected to travel 25% of your time to our international Partners and their customers.

You are driven by success and have a commercial and sales driven mindset!

You have an entrepreneurial mindset and can engage effectively with all levels both internally and externally. Your previous experience in negotiations and customer-facing presentations will help you to be successful. Being fluent in English and additionally Dutch or German is required. Every company has a mission. At Accruent, ours is to fundamentally change the way organizations run their built environment. By delivering data-led intelligence, Accruent can transform the way people and systems work together and help them drive business forward. We’re mission ready.
Are you? Because our International Channel Sales team is looking for a:
Partner Manager - Location: the Netherlands or Germany
What are your responsibilities:
As Partner Manager, your responsibilities will be designing and executing our Partner Program, together with our partners, while developing strong relationships, growing our market footprint and driving revenue and growth. You will facilitate alignment between partner organizations and our internal sales and marketing team to develop objectives, strategies and manage them throughout the partner lifecycle. You will always have a focus on further developing our partners, so that we can grow our footprint, whilst identifying new opportunities in both existing and new partner accounts.
But what type of daily activities should you think of?
Based on the agreed Partner Program, you’ll support the partner in developing joint activities;
You will join/guide our partners in customer/prospects meetings for presentations and negotiations where you will represent Accruent and the partner. Your sales experience will help you drive opportunities to a win. When needed you will onboard new partners and will conduct sales training. Other than that, you will proactively assess, clarify, and validate our partner's needs, and ensure that our partners are compliant with our agreements. All of the above, while tracking performance objectives, forecasts, and reports.
In this role, you will be mainly responsible for positioning Accruent’s Meridian and Maintenance Connection solution and will be responsible for the Benelux/DACH, UK, and Pacific region. As Partner Manager, you will report directly to the Director of Channel Sales.
What we offer:
We offer you a great opportunity in which you will work together as one team, with people all over the world and get the chance to contribute to the success of our customers and Partners. It will be your time to develop and grow in an innovative, dynamic, and fast-moving environment, where you'll receive a competitive remuneration package, but most importantly the opportunity to build your own success. We at Accruent, create an environment where there is room for ideas and initiatives, experiences are impactful, and talent is developed. Currently, all our employees are working from home, due to the COVID-19 situation. Once we are allowed to, you will be working in our fully refurnished modern new office in Hoofddorp and you are expected to travel 25% of your time to our international Partners and their customers.
What you bring to the table:
You are driven by success and have a commercial and sales driven mindset!
We are looking for someone with at least 3 years of experience within SaaS both in direct and Channel/Partner Sales, who understands/has experience in the heavy asset/manufacturing industry. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and can engage effectively with all levels both internally and externally. Your previous experience in negotiations and customer-facing presentations will help you to be successful. Being fluent in English and additionally Dutch or German is required. A Bachelor degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or related would be a plus.
If you got excited about the opportunity, then you can directly apply via the apply button!
We will be happy to help and share even more details with you.
We hope to hear from you soon!
Due to the international character of our hiring team, we kindly ask you to apply in English.
All employment offers are made contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. A background check may include: verification of education and past employment, criminal background reports, motor vehicle driving records, or reference checks. The company is the sole determinant of a successful background check. Assessment may be part of the application process.

Job Summary:
Disney Streaming Services is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the Disney+ ADK Partner Integration Software Engineering Team in Amsterdam. You’ll be part of a highly collaborative global team exploring the latest connected and set-top box (STB) devices on the market.

We’re searching for a passionate engineer who's proficient at C/C++ in a set-top-box (STB) and/or embedded systems world and also has experience writing cross platform code, porting applications and runtimes across multiple hardware platforms.


What you’ll do:

Be a critical member of a team of engineers responsible for porting our next generation platform and apps for embedded and set-top box devices.
Supporting development activities and tooling requirements
Work with hardware manufacturing partners to vet and optimize new hardware.
Work with network operator partners to assist them in porting our work to their hardware.
Maintain a strong understanding of our native client platform (written in C/C++) to identify, research and address issues as they arise.
Support efforts and use cases related to DRM, A/V playback, performance, toolchains, middleware (MW) and/or OS, driver level decoding and decryption, etc.
Collaborate with client application development teams, services engineering teams and product to help understand and explain device limitations and requirements.

Your Background

Around 5+ years of C/C++ experience on embedded systems and/or writing portable multi-platform code.
Understanding of various chip architectures and what features they support
Experience using build runners / compilation tools for multi-platform projects
Experience mentoring junior level team members.
Customer support and troubleshooting experience
Familiarity with multiple operating systems, with one of them being Linux or Linux like
Exposure to use of set-top-box or similar embedded devices
When global conditions permit, some travel, including international travel, may be required.

Bonus points if:
Familiarity with set-top box and/or embedded device development such as system-on-chips (SoCs) from manufacturers like Broadcom, MediaTek, SigmaTel, etc.
Cross-platform application programming interface for rendering 2D and 3D vector graphics such as OpenGL/EGL
Window management solutions both custom and open such as X11, Wayland, etc.
Cross device/distribution dependency management
Audio/Video pipeline management using technologies such as GStreamer
Large code base exposure such as Webkit, WPE, Chromium, Cobalt
DRM/CDM
Familiarity with multiple embedded operating systems and with toolchains and cross-compiler use

Our toolset also includes:
Multiple IDE use exposure, i.e. Visual Studio, Eclipse, etc.
Confluence, JIRA
Docker, AWS
Linux / Windows / Mac
GCC toolchains, Gdb and/or other debuggers
Jenkins and other automation related tooling

Large code base exposure such as Webkit, WPE, Chromium, Cobalt
DRM/CDM
Familiarity with multiple embedded operating systems and with toolchains and cross-compiler use

Our toolset also includes:
Multiple IDE use exposure, i.e. Visual Studio, Eclipse, etc.
Confluence, JIRA
Docker, AWS
Linux / Windows / Mac
GCC toolchains, Gdb and/or other debuggers
Jenkins and other automation related tooling

Job Summary:
Disney Streaming Services is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the Disney+ ADK Partner Integration Software Engineering Team in Amsterdam. You’ll be part of a highly collaborative global team exploring the latest connected and set-top box (STB) devices on the market.

We’re searching for a passionate engineer who's proficient at C/C++ in a set-top-box (STB) and/or embedded systems world and also has experience writing cross platform code, porting applications and runtimes across multiple hardware platforms.


What you’ll do:

Be a critical member of a team of engineers responsible for porting our next generation platform and apps for embedded and set-top box devices.
Supporting development activities and tooling requirements
Work with hardware manufacturing partners to vet and optimize new hardware.
Work with network operator partners to assist them in porting our work to their hardware.
Maintain a strong understanding of our native client platform (written in C/C++) to identify, research and address issues as they arise.
Support efforts and use cases related to DRM, A/V playback, performance, toolchains, middleware (MW) and/or OS, driver level decoding and decryption, etc.
Collaborate with client application development teams, services engineering teams and product to help understand and explain device limitations and requirements.

Your Background

Around 5+ years of C/C++ experience on embedded systems and/or writing portable multi-platform code.
Understanding of various chip architectures and what features they support
Experience using build runners / compilation tools for multi-platform projects
Experience mentoring junior level team members.
Customer support and troubleshooting experience
Familiarity with multiple operating systems, with one of them being Linux or Linux like
Exposure to use of set-top-box or similar embedded devices
When global conditions permit, some travel, including international travel, may be required.

Bonus points if:
Familiarity with set-top box and/or embedded device development such as system-on-chips (SoCs) from manufacturers like Broadcom, MediaTek, SigmaTel, etc.
Cross-platform application programming interface for rendering 2D and 3D vector graphics such as OpenGL/EGL
Window management solutions both custom and open such as X11, Wayland, etc.
Cross device/distribution dependency management
Audio/Video pipeline management using technologies such as GStreamer
Large code base exposure such as Webkit, WPE, Chromium, Cobalt
DRM/CDM
Familiarity with multiple embedded operating systems and with toolchains and cross-compiler use

Our toolset also includes:
Multiple IDE use exposure, i.e. Visual Studio, Eclipse, etc.
Confluence, JIRA
Docker, AWS
Linux / Windows / Mac
GCC toolchains, Gdb and/or other debuggers
Jenkins and other automation related tooling

LIFE AT IMC AS C++ SOFTWARE ENGINEER
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO
IMC is a leading global market maker, using algorithmic trading and advanced technology to buy and sell securities on multiple trading venues worldwide. We provide liquidity to the financial markets, driving efficiencies for buyers and sellers.
Founded in 1989, we are an ambitious, innovative company and identified early on the importance technology would play in the fast-paced evolution of trading. This entrepreneurial spirit still drives us today and can be found in all of our offices around the world.
OUR TEAM
We now operate globally from offices in Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. Our employees work closely together in multidisciplinary teams, making our success possible.
Technology - At IMC, technology is not a department, it is at the heart of everything we do. Our technologists push the limits of possibility, and then look beyond. In our fast-paced environment, short feedback loops mean projects worked on in the morning can enter production the next day.
Trading – Although our traders come from many backgrounds they all have one thing in common: they are at their best solving complex problems. Their insight into global events, market shifts and pricing ensure we are trading in the right place, at the right time.
Business Support - Around the world, IMC’s business support teams are essential for sustaining our success. In our dynamic environment, we have many exciting challenges and multidisciplinary opportunities to shape our operations and make a real impact.
OUR CULTURE
Our employees are our greatest asset so we give them lots of responsibility and the support they need to make a difference. Our flat structure fosters a culture of openness and collaboration, encouraging the sharing of ideas and knowledge. It makes no difference if you have been with us for three days or three years, the best idea wins.
While we work hard, we also have a lot of fun; whether solving complex challenges or in team building, leisure and sporting activities. IMC also enables its employees to contribute towards a better society through our foundation.
SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AT IMC:
We trade in the most competitive markets across the globe. Our software makes millions of trading decisions daily. We win by making better and faster decisions than our competition . As a software developer you’ll be working with traders and engineers to implement strategies that will challenge you to be creative with your implementation. You’ll need to produce solutions which compete in the extremely latency sensitive environment, whilst managing complexity.
You’ll be working in a highly motivated A msterdam based team dedicated to delivering challenging projects for our Amsterdam and/or Chicago offices , while controlling end-to-end product development.
We work in an environment where slight oversights can be extremely costly, while new features can be extremely profitable. As a team we aim to balance the race to production with software quality and testability. You’ll be placed in an environment consisting primarily of Java and C++. We have a build chain which has been designed around the concept of daily production releases . An ever-evolving variety of systems and technologies keeps life interesting.
Upon joining you will be expected to manage your own time and tasks. We rely on our developers to drive change by taking feedback from traders, and shaping that into an implementation. Your ownership of the task continues until a working production release . Our most successful developers comfortably work in any part of our stack.
WHAT MAKES IT FUN?
One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a quick feedback loop. We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are developed
We operate at the bleeding edge of technology. If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution
We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all 3 regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.
To get the best results we encourage everybody to gain an understanding of both the trading strategy and how exchanges work on a technological level.
Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets . We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.
We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds. What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach.
OUR HIRING PROCESS
To set you up for success, you can find our hiring process including tips on applying and interviewing with us on our website . Now it’s up to you! Apply today to start an amazing journey with IMC.
